loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a small shop, as there is a space available for rent and he would like to take advantage of this opportunity.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
The borrower is 61 years old and a widow with four adult-age children.

Luz has been an animal feed retailer for two years and the profit from her business was her primary source of income. Part of her profits were deposited so that there will be an increase on her investments.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of various animal feeds and veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Ma. Petronila

texts.en: Ma.Petronila is 61 years old, widowed and has five children. To earn income, she sews school and office uniforms. She has had a sewing business for over five years now. She wants to improve her output and is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy thread and fabrics to use in her sewing business. She hopes to keep producing a better output to satisfy her customers' demand and gain good profit.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabrics to use in her sewing business

loans.name: Cesar Nervardo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive el señor Cesar, tiene 37 años de edad, está soltero y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 8 años que estudian  en escuela, vive en la casa de sus padres. 
Don Cesar vende ropa de  todo tipo recorriendo la ciudad,  da crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a como prefieran sus clientes. Lleva 1 año dedicado a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
El está repitiendo el crédito, gracias a los créditos el pudo comprar su mercadería al contado y así con esto obtuvo mejores ganancias las cuales le sirven para salir adelante. Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos años y a través de los créditos él ha podido financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Salud y Progreso Communal Bank meets every fifteen days. The city is known for being a dynamic place, where the majority of the residents make their living in agriculture and animal husbandry, as it is an area with abundant vegetation. This is where Cesar, 37, lives. Cesar is single, with two children, ages 8 and 9, who go to school. They live with Cesar's parents. 

Cesar goes all over the city selling different types of clothes. He sells on credit, and collects payments every week or every fifteen days, according to his customers' preferences. He has been working in this business for one year, which has allowed him to get ahead. He is requesting this loan again; thanks to his previous loan, he was able to purchase merchandise in one cash payment, and thus earned more profits which allowed him to come out ahead. 

This loan will be used to purchase different types of clothing. He has been with the communal bank for two years, and thanks to their credits, he has been able to finance his business. He dreams of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Elba Teodora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Elba, tiene 77 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 15 hijos,  5 fallecieron y los 10 que aun están vivos son mayores de edad,  ella vive en casa de una hija.
Doña Elba es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para así salir adelante, ella tiene una granja en su casa donde cría pollos, tiene más de 300 pollos por temporada y para esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de una persona a quien le paga por sus servicios para que le cuide la finca y le ayude con la crianza de los pollos, ella compra los pollos muy pequeños, los cría por tres meses y luego cuando tienen un desarrollo adecuado los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su hogar, así ella sale adelante sola.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pollos, medicinas y alimentos para los mismos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre los créditos le ayudan  mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Salud y Progreso” [Health and Progress] credit group meets in the city of Tosagua every fifteen days. This area is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its population works in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with a large amount of vegetation.

Elba lives here, and she is 77 years old. Many years ago, her husband passed away and she was left a widow. She had fifteen children in her marriage. Five of her children passed away, and the ten that are still alive are adults now.

Elba has had to work hard in order to get ahead. She grows chickens at home. She raises more than 300 chickens every season and pays a person that helps her to take care of the facilities and the animals. She buys the chickens when they are very small, and raises them for three months. When they reach the right size, she sells them to businesspeople that visit her. In this way, she gets ahead on her own.

Elba will use this loan to buy chickens, and medicines and feed for them. She has been a member of this group since the beginning, and she likes being one because these loans always help her. Her dream is to be a healthy person.

loans.use: to buy chickens, and medicines and feed for them.

loans.name: Bella Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Bella, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Bella junto al esposo tienen un restaurante  en su casa, allí ellos con la ayuda de una sobrina a quien le paga por sus servicios  preparan deliciosos platos, preparan  desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, día a día ella varia el menú con la intención de complacer  a sus clientes,  trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00.  Tiene más de 8  años con su restaurante el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 10 años  y le gusta porque con ayuda de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su restaurante.
texts.en:
The "Salud y Progreso" (Health and Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Tosagua, a place known for being quite dynamic and where the majority of the residents make their livings in agriculture and raising animals.  It is an area with a lot of vegetation.
This is where señora Bella lives.  She is 52-years old, married and has six grown children.  One of her children still lives with her.  Her husband is a shop keeper. 
Doña Bella and her husband have a restaurant set up in their house.  With the help of a niece, who they pay for her work, they prepare delicious plates of food: breakfasts, lunches and suppers.  Doña Bella changes the menu each day to keep her customers happy.  She works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm.  She has had her restaurant for over eight years, and it has allowed them to get ahead. 
Doña Bella will use this loan to purchase rice, meat, fish and other provisions for preparing her food.  She has been with her communal bank for ten years.  She likes it because she was able to start her business with the help of the loans.  Her dream is to continue improving her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, fish and other provisions.

loans.name: Ramiro Geovanny

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive el señor Ramiro, tiene 35 años de edad, está soltero y vive en la casa de su mamá. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con ayuda de los créditos sale adelante.
Don Ramiro es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ganar lo suyo para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su mamá a salir adelante, él hace mas de 3 años surtió en su casa  una tienda de víveres donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también carnes, legumbres, frutas entre otros productos, con la ayuda de su mamá cada día va mejorando su negocio el cual les permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas que vende. Sus sueños son seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The Crédito Salud y Progreso group meets in the city of Tosagua every fifteen days. This place as known as being very dynamic, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and animal husbandry, as it is a very green region.

Señor Ramiro lives here. He is 35 years old, single, and lives at home with his mother. He has been a member of the group for three cycles and he likes it because he can move forwards with the support of loans.

Ramiro is a very hard-working man who likes earning his own money to succeed and support his mother. More than three years ago, he set up a grocery store in his home where he sells all kinds of basic products, meat, vegetables, fruit and other goods. With his mother's help, his business improves every day, which allows them to move forwards.
 
This loan is to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other items to sell. Ramiro's dream is to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Karen Yolanda

texts.en:
Karen Yolanda is 33 years old and married with one child. Karen Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Karen Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year now. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Karen Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ntagoheka Group

texts.fr:
Laurence fait partie du groupe  Ntagoheka et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a  33 ans et est mariée à Venant, un agriculteur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 9 ans  dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de riz  depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de riz   à  revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Laurence is a member of the Ntagoheka group and lives in Gitega. She is 33 years and married to Venant, a farmer. They have four children ranging from three to nine years of age, two of whom attend school.

Laurence has been selling rice for 10 years. She is on her fourth loan  with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan she will bolster her capital and buy a large quantity of rice for resale so as to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice for resale.

loans.name: Anenia

texts.en:
Anenia is a hard working, married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

Anenia runs a retail shop as his main source of income alongside farming to earn extra income. He started this business to earn more income and improve his standard of living. A high rate of defaulters and delayed payments of debts are his main problem. However, he has a vision of expanding his business, having educated children and an empowered family.

He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, bread, soap and crates of soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, soap and crates of soda to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 56 years old and single with one child in school. Lorna  works very hard to provide for her family's needs.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, and groceries..

Lorna has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Alozious

texts.en: Alozious is a hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his pineapple farm. In addition to farming, he runs a retail shop for income. He started this business to have a better standard of living and to look after his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, juice, salt and other items to sell in his shop. He has a vision of owning a wholesale shop and becoming a modernized farmer.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, juice, salt and other items to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Elsy

texts.es:
Gloria de 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos ya que su esposo emigró a los EE.UU. hace siete años, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela por lo cual ha realizado cualquier tipo de trabajo doméstico.

 
Actualmente a lo que se dedica es a la agricultura, lo hace desde hace 3 años, ella cultiva una hectárea de maíz, lo cual le sirve de mucho para vender y para la alimentación del hogar..    

El crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde va a cultivar, y también comprará una novilla.

Gloria sueña con cultivar más hectáreas de  maíz para aumentar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old and lives with her four children since her husband emigrated to the US seven years ago. She never had the chance to study, which is why she has done all kinds of domestic work.

She currently works in agriculture, and has done so for three years. She grows a hectare of corn, which is very useful to sell and feed her family.

She needs the loan to pay the rental fees for the plot of land where she is going to grow plants, and to buy a heifer.

Gloria dreams of growing more hectares of corn to boost her earnings and support her children.

loans.use: to pay the rental fees for the plot of land where she is going to grow plants, and to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Ekrem

texts.en: Ekrem is the married father of 3 children. He is very hardworking and does much in order to support his family and give his children what they need and want. He is currently employed with a private company as a construction worker. He also has a small farm where he keeps cows for both personal use and for sale of the milk and other dairy products. By using the milk for his family, he is able to cut back on expenses and provide nutrition to his children. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to renovate the stable where he keeps his cows. This will allow him to provide a good environment to his animals and help keep them safe and healthy. His goal is to have own private construction company and also to add more cows to his farm. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate the stable where he keeps his cows

loans.name: José Misael

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, vive solo ya que su esposa y sus dos hijos emigraron a EE.UU. por lo cual él trabaja para seguir adelante solo.


José ya tiene 15 años de trabajar en el mercado como vendedor de verduras, se levanta desde muy temprano para irse al mercado e iniciar sus labores, siendo este negocio su fuente principal de ingresos económicos.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar más verduras como tomates, cebollas, papas, chiles, etc. Para tener más surtido su negocio en el mercado.


Él espera seguir adelante con su negocio, tener más clientes y volver a ver a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 56 years of age, lives alone, as his wife and their two children emigrated to the United States. He works to get ahead by himself. Jose has been working in the market for 15 years as a vegetable vendor. He gets up very early to go to the market and start his work, as this business is his main source of income.

Jose needs this loan to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, chili peppers, etc., in order to offer a better selection at the market. He hopes to get ahead with his business, to have more customers, and to see his children again.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, chili peppers, etc., in order to offer a better selection at the market

loans.name: Marlene Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Marlene, tiene 57 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos mayores de edad,  dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella.
Doña Marlene es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para así salir adelante, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también carnes, legumbres, frutas, etc. allí también su hija tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales vende productos de Avon y otros productos de catalogo con lo cual se ayudan con estas ganancias, lleva más de 3 años con este negocio el cual les permite ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar: víveres para surtir su tienda, carnes, frutas entre otras cosas. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Salud y Progreso” [Health and Progress] meets fortnightly in Tosagua, a city known for being very dynamic. Most locals work in agriculture and animal farming, because it is an area with a large amount of vegetation. This is where Marlene, 57, lives. Some years ago, her husband died and she was left a widow. She had four children in her marriage; all of them are adults, and two of them still live with her.

Marlene has had to work very hard to get ahead. She has a grocery store at home, where she sells all kinds of staple food. She also sells different types of meat, vegetables and fruits. Her daughter sells Avon products, and some other products from a catalogue, which she displays in showcases. In this way she helps her mother. Marlene has been in business for more than three years, which helps her to make an honest living.

With this loan, she will buy products for her store, such as different types of meat, and fruits. She has been a member of this credit group for more than two years and likes to be one, because these loans help her a lot. Her dream is to give her family all the best.

loans.use: to buy products for her store, such as meat and fruits.

loans.name: Rosa Florisdalba

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar  la señora Rosa, tiene 77 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 8 hijos mayores de edad,  ella vive en casa de una hija.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo para así poder salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, la mayor parte de sus prendas las vende en su casa ya que los clientes la buscan por que vende prendas muy bonitas y de buena calidad, su hija también le ayuda con sus ventas ya que ella no puede salir por su edad, es su hija la que le ayuda con los cobros  ya que deja a crédito y cobra casa semana. De esta forma ella se gana lo suyo y no depende de nadie.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Salud y Progreso group meet in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and animal husbandry, as it is a very green region.

Señora Rosa lives here. She is 77 years old. Several years ago, her husband died and she became a widow. However, she had eight children with him, who are now all grown up, and she lives in the house of one of her daughters.

Rosa is a woman who lives to make her own money so that she can move forwards. She makes a living as a trader, selling different kinds of clothing. She sells most of her items from her home, as her customers visit her because she sells very pretty, high-quality clothing. Her daughter also helps her with her sales as she is unable to go out because of her age. Her daughter helps her to collect money owed to her, because she sells on credit and collects the money every week. This is how she makes her own money and doesn't have to rely on anyone else.

This loan is to buy all kinds of clothing. She has been a member of the group since it began and she likes it because the loans help her to move forwards. Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Francisca Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de una hermana y varios sobrinos que son muy queridos por ella.
Doña Francisca es maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero también se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de ciclo largo como mangos, mandarinas, naranjas, cacao, así como plantas maderables y verduras, para esto ella contrata personal que es el que se encarga de los trabajos, es así como ella se gana algo extra que le da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas y abonos para los cultivos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the group Credito Salud y Progreso meets every fifteen days. The city is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and in raising livestock because it is an area with lush vegetation.

This is where Francisca lives. She is 60 years old, single, and lives with her sister and her nephews whom she loves very much.

Francisca is a teacher in a neighborhood school but she also works in agriculture and has different crops such as mangoes, mandarins, oranges, and cacao. Her plants are all tree growing and so she hires seasonal workers to help her work the fields. Her crops and subsequent harvests help bring in a little extra money that her family needs.

Today's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and manure. She has been with the group Credito Salud y Progreso since the beginning and she likes being a member because they are big help to her. Her dream is to continue to get ahead and to have her health.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, insecticides and manure.

loans.name: Safari Kibaha Group

texts.en:
Mwapendo, who is in her mid 40s, is single with four children, one still in school and the other three grown up.  She has been a food vendor for 13 years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Mwapendo's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to open a store for selling charcoal and to increase the food stock. She dreams of owning a genge (grocery store) business.

Mwapendo will share this loan with her loan group "Safari Kibaha," which consists of eight people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a store for selling charcoal and to increase the food stock.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is the mother of one child and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines and earns additional income from running a general store. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her jewelry business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell for her jewelry business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a vinegar vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of vinegar to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of vinegar

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan sends his greetings to Kiva lenders and thanks them for his previous two Kiva loans that supported him so much. Stepan lives with his family in the village of Verin Ptghni, which is in the Kotayk region of Armenia. Stepan has several occupations which helps him to sustain his family's needs. He is a skilled and very good shoemaker, running his own small shoe production business which he managed to develop thanks to the Kiva loan. He also is engaged in farming his plot of land, growing cucumbers, tomatoes, garlic, pepper and greens mainly for his family's needs. Stepan works hard and he usually has no difficulties pursuing both occupations. Lately, however, he has felt weak and is experiencing discomfort near his heart.  
With this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams Stepan will undergo a very urgent medical examination of his heart, which will help to find out whether Stepan needs surgery.

loans.use: to pay for an urgent medical examination of his heart

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is married and works hard to support her family. She buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Letecia has been in this business for 25 years. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (Kiva's partner) to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva used the previous loan to buy synthetic hair for use in her salon. Eva is a 31-year-old married mother of three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Eva has been operating a beauty saloon for six years. She has a dream of educating her children and turning her business into a modern beauty salon providing bridal services. However,she is faced with the challenge of limited capital to buy enough stock that can satisfy her customers' demands. Eva intends to use the loan to buy synthetic hair for use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair for use in her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 46-year-old, hard-working married man. He used his previous loan to hire workers to clear the bush on his farmland and plant more bananas. He still deals in agriculture and has continued to grow sugar cane and bananas as his main sources of income. He also raises cattle and earns a monthly salary. He has been able to educate his children with profits from his businesses. He still faces a challenge of unpredictable weather changes. However, he has a vision of expanding his farm and educating his children to the university level.

Ben is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Basri

texts.en:
Basri wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which he has used to pay for his taxi registration and to purchase new winter tires for the season. That loan helped him continue doing business in a safe and reliable manner and continue to generate income for his family. It was an important investment for his business, which is the main source of his income. 

Basri is now requesting another loan to pay once again for his registration as it is due again. He is happy for the opportunity to borrow once again and continue with his business, which has been successful and lucrative for him so far. He promises to pay once again on time and is grateful for the continued support from the lenders.

loans.use: To pay for the registration of his taxi

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old hardworking married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a butcher, and also earns a monthly income from his rentals. He was inspired by the need to carter for his family to start up that business. He faces a challenge of scarcity of resources to buy more animals to slaughter, however, he hopes to expand his business and have educated children.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: to buy more goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya is 52 years old and blessed with 11 children. Despite being widowed, she has the determination to uplift her family's status of living and give her children a better life. Aside from being a farmer, she also sells used clothing, fruits and vegetables at the public market during market days. She aims to improve this business in order to generate a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional used clothing, fruits and vegetables to resell. Ligaya believes that she will improve her business someday.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing, fruits and vegetables to resell

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 61 years old and has only one child. They live in a rural community and make their living by farming. She also engages in hog raising to generate additional income. She aims to further improve this business in order to earn a higher income and help her husband in satisfying their daily needs. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old. She is known in the Pagadian area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra has wide experience in farming. She has mastered rice farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Alejandra has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Alejandra has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. 

Someday, Alejandra  hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah is 55 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, now at their adult age. Devorah has been earning a living from the sales at her sari-sari store business. She's been engaged in this business just a year. She earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Devorah became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) just this year. In the future, Devorah hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Edith Jhonny

texts.es:
Edith Jhonny tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su moto carguera, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado. Con esto, Edith Jhonny espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edith Jhonny is 31 years old, single and lives in his family's home in a rural district of Oyotún, which can be found in the province of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. This area has agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Edith Jhonny has a transportation service and he runs it from his home. He has been doing this for 3 years and he has many personal and professional references. He is asking for a loan in order to repair and maintain his vehicle. He hopes that this will help him to provide a better service to his customers and to earn more money. All of this will help him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip makes a good living in gardening activities, planting squash in Aloran, in the Philippines. This is his means of supporting his family. However, Philip is in need of working capital. 

He presented his project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to pay for compost, fertilizer and herbicides. 

Philip has high hopes that his crop will have a good, high-quality yield and earn a promising return.

loans.use: to pay for compost, fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana, age 64, is from Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is has been separated for more than two decades, and has 4 adult-age children.  

Victoriana joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her snack vending business. Helping the family survive, she gives her best ability to make delicious food snacks in order to sell it all out. 

Victoriana is now trying to expand her business; she presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project, and has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business, and additional cooking utensils.  

She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with adequate income.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business, and additional cooking utensils

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 44 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children, who are now at their adult age and school age. 

Lucila has been engaged in a charcoal processing and selling business as her new means of earning for a living. She's been doing this for about one year already, and earns approximately PHP1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing more coconut shells and good woods for charcoal processing and selling. 

Lucila has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future Lucila hopes to expand her charcoal processing business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells and good woods for charcoal processing and selling

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en:
Marrisa is 28 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc. 

Marrisa has been in this business for two years.

In the future Marrisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bennie

texts.en:
Bennie is 38 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Bennie has borrowed and repaid one previous loan from NWTF. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old, married and has 10 children, five who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gina has been farming vegetables for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid one previous loan from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional househod goods to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. Analiza is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: In 2008, Rose ventured into farming as a way of life so that she could be able to produce food for her family. Six years down the line, Rose is deep into commercial dairy and crop farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments have helped elevate the quality of life led by her children who are in school. Rose is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats and expand her crop farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more land, more farm inputs, more equipment and more labor. Crops aside, the other concern Rose is dealing with is the shift in preference in the dairy industry. Goat milk demand is on a steady rise in Kenya. As more people in Kenya are favoring goat milk because of its nutritional value, cattle farmers are being forced to start adopting dairy goat farming. Caught up in this situation, Rose will find your loan very handy. With KES 30,000, she will be able to purchase a couple of dairy goats to start with. She is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her crop production. She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: To pay for dairy goats and expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Cypriano

texts.en:
Cypriano is a 36-year-old, hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop and also does farming to earn extra income. He has been able to improve his standard of living to have a better life. Cypriano faces a challenge of competition, price fluctuations and a high rate of defaulters. He has a vision of expanding his business into a wholesale shop.

Cypriano is requesting a loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt and other goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 27-year-old, hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more rice, beans, and millet to sell. He still deals in produce-selling and also runs a motorcycle transport business to earn extra income. He started this business to have a better standard of living and look after his family. He still faces challenges of competition, price fluctuation and high rate of taxation. He has a vision of becoming a leading produce seller and having educated children.

Juma will use the loan to buy more rice, beans, and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, and millet to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Alice, 42 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Mururi, a remote village in Kerugoya. She is happily married and is blessed with an adorable family. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years, and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kerugoya area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

Support an entrepreneur with innovative ideas who is searching for a way to support her parents, and her children's studies.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en:
Damazo is a hard-working married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell. He still owns a bar/shop as his main source of income and also runs a butchery to earn more income. He started this business to improve his standard of living and look after his family. Damazo has personal goals of educating his children to higher levels and becoming a prominent businessman. His main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands of his customers. 

He needs a loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell. He still has hopes of having a wholesale depot in the future.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 49-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle rearing and selling, alongside farming. He started this business to increase his income inflow, and look after his family.  He has hardships of competition, lack of capital and price fluctuations of animals in the market; however he has a vision of owning a big, known and advanced farm.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for rearing and selling at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing and selling at his farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man, age 47, who lives in Kagadi, Uganda where he works in fish mongering and farming to earn income. However hard working Joseph is, he is challenged by bad weather that makes it difficult for him to transport his products to the market. He desires to improve his family’s standard of living. He is asking for a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 35-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is produce farming, alongside cattle rearing and selling. He started this business to increase his income inflow and support his family.  He has hardships of lack of capital, poor roads that make service delivery difficult and price fluctuations; however he has a vision of becoming a model farmer. 

He is requesting a loan to buy maize, coffee, and other things for his farm.

loans.use: to buy maize, coffee and  things for his farm.

loans.name: Sofyan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of our Ruma agents, Sofyan. Sofyan lives in Cimulang, Bogor, West Java. He lives there with his wife and his two daughters. He already has been with Ruma for a year. He feels happy because ever since he joined Ruma, he can improve his business and save more money for another business opportunity.

At the first time, Sofyan was only selling mobile airtime credits to his customers, but now, he is adding one more product from Ruma called ‘Mapan’. ‘Mapan’ is a new product from Ruma, an e-commerce for lower communities. By providing Mapan to his customers, Sofyan will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Sofyan will simply send an SMS in a format to the SMS center and then the customer will pay him. After it, Ruma’s agent will come to his stall to collect the money and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door.

As the business grows, Sofyan needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits. Sofyan’s track record in the past time in selling mobile airtime credits has been quite impressive because of the high demand from the customers toward the mobile phone airtime credits itself. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sofyan improve his business and accordingly, help his community, who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Sofyan is the one who is standing in his own small stall - holding a Ruma poster. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 28-year-old single man who works as a chef in a restaurant to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man and hard worker who is trying desperately to improve his living conditions and increase his income. Lately, he opened a mobile phone shop as a second source of income where he sells mobiles and prepaid cards.

Today, Alaa is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his new business by increasing his merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones to attract more customers and satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones to attract customers

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is 51 years old, married and has six children. She runs a store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She hopes to increase her profits but she needs to increase her merchandise. So she is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits and soap to sell. The increased merchandise will help increase the sales capacity in her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits and soap

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is a 64-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is from Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental and is industriously caring for her fishing activities. She is a widow and has four children. She personally takes charge of her business, and her children work for her as support. The business is doing well. She has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time, make earnings from it.

The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman.

Now, she sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

She deeply wishes for her children to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 62 years old, married and a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. They have six children, two of whom are in college now.

Starting with capitalization of 4,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (small grocery) store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2013 and has taken out three loans.

Now she is applying for 7,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she can renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 69 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children, all of whom are now adults.
 
Antonieta has been engaged in fishing activity for more than 20 years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Her earnings are so helpful in meeting her needs. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase fishing tools and fishing nets for her livelihood. 

Antonieta has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 10 years. In the future, she hopes to acquire additional fishing boats and fishing equipment to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing tools and fishing nets.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with 5 children, living with her family in Lopez Jaena, in the Philippines. She is a diligent and determined businesswoman. 

A hardworking mother who has always been known to provide the best for her family, Julieta earns a living by making snacks that she sells herself, and also by consignment in shops and cafes. 

Julieta has decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Consequently, she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase her snack production. 

Julieta's goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and eating place in her area. With her husband's help and support, Julieta smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing their children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to increase her snack production.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 24 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Jo Rose Aura

texts.en:
Jo Rose Aura is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jo Rose Aura has been in this business for seven years. Jo Rose Aura earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 60-year-old, hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells second hand clothes in open markets as his main source of income. He was inspired to start this business to increase his income and look after his family. He faces challenges of competition, seasonal customers and weather changes that stop customers from turning up. James has hopes that in the future, he will own a wholesale permanent boutique.

He will use the loan to buy more second hand-clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives in the nice village of Agarak in the Lori region of Armenia. Nune has a higher education with a specialty in pedagogue. She works at the village school as a teacher of elementary classes. Nune has two sons; her elder son is married and he lives with his family separately and her younger son is a student at the State Medical University on scholarship.  

She says she likes to spend any remaining free time after work in her greenhouse, which she managed to build with her husband. She enjoys watering and taking care of her planted vegetables, such as cucumbers, tomatoes, garlic, onions and greens. She manages to sell all these products right from her house to re-sellers. 

Nune will be happy to receive this loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and also vegetable seedlings for her greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and also seedlings of vegetables for her greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! James is a hardworking, ambitious, and go-getter farmer who is 57 years of age. He hails from Kiamugunda, a small village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. He comes from a very humble background; he did not manage to attend college, but that did not kill his spirit to succeed.

He has actively been involved in farming for the past 10 years. Although he has made great strides in farming, he wants to diversify his farming and is kindly seeking a loan to buy pigs. Pig farming is one of the profitable agricultural ventures in Kenya and James, having an entrepreneur's mind, wants to take advantage of that to improve his living conditions. James loves pig farming because pigs are not demanding to keep, unlike poultry, which require special care and attention. James believes that with the loan his life will permanently change because he will be selling pork meat to a ready and available market. As far as the market of pig products is concerned, demand is greater than supply. James always says, “To become a successful pig farmer you need three ingredients and that is getting the right breed, giving the right feed, and proper care." 

With the loan he believes he will become a successful pig farmer and will be able to realize his dream of transforming his life. Having farmed for the past 10 years, James finds it very enjoyable to raise pigs because he does not spend more money on buying food. Pigs feed on remains that can be collected from hotels and restaurants and hence save a lot of money. James will also sell manure from the pigs and use it on his farm, also saving much more money and improving his living conditions. Profits from selling pig meat to the local market and to the industry that produces sausages and bacon will be used to fully repay the loan. Your support of this go-getting farmer could give him an enormous push. With what he earns, he will repay the loan and pay for the studies of his children and siblings.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is 56 years old and she lives in the city of Vedi, which is in the Ararat region. During all the years after graduating the institute, Siranush remained faithful to her profession of pedagogue and now also she works at the school as a teacher of drawing. Siranush says that she likes her work at school very much, and she does her best to make her lessons interesting and attractive for her pupils. 

She is married and she has a son. Siranush’s husband works as a driver, and her son provides construction services in his city. Her daughter-in-law is unemployed, as she takes care of the children.

Siranush asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, since she wants to buy a computer and a printer; these are very important tools for her work, which she never managed to buy, having financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 49 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

Anabelle has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George used his previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a 46-year-old, hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a businessman who owns a retail shop to earn a living although he also practices livestock agriculture. George faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand and the prolonged dry spell leading to lack of water and pastures for his animals. He has hopes of becoming a prominent businessman.

George has asked for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Unicent

texts.en:
Unicent is a thirty-seven-year-old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the past five years. He mainly grows coffee and maize, and he has been able to sustain his family and educate his children.

He also owns a maize-milling machine, which earns him an extra income. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are his main challenges. However, he hopes to have an improved business that is well stocked.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He deals in livestock to earn extra income, alongside farming and his monthly salary. He has been able to improve his standard of living and have a better life. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to expand his farm and unpredictable weather changes especially the dry season.

Gordon has a vision of owning a permanent house and becoming an exemplary farmer.

He intends to use the loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado debido a que sus padres  no le dieron la oportunidad de continuar por la situación económica, está casado y tiene dos hijos, por lo que día   con día trabaja para que no les falte la alimentación.
 

Juan ya tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la albañilería lo cual tiene mucha experiencia en construcción y es como él puede ganarse la vida a diario y cubrir los gastos del hogar. Su esposa atiende una venta de licuados pues es un negocio que han iniciado juntos.

Él necesita el crédito para construir una galera para la venta de licuados que atiende su esposa.

Él espera que el negocio funciones y que no falte lo básico para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 36, studied until ninth grade, as his parents couldn't give him to opportunity continue his education due to their economic situation. He is married with two children, for whom he works every day so they have enough to eat. Juan has been working as a bricklayer for 12 years, which has given him a lot of experience in construction, and this is how he makes a living and covers his household expenses. 

His wife looks after the fruit drink business that they started together. He needs this loan to build a space to sell the drinks prepared by his wife. He hopes that this business is a success, and that his family has everything they need.

loans.use: to build a space to sell blended fruit drinks prepared by his wife.

loans.name: Tomas Group

texts.en:
Tomas is 42 years old and has eight children. He leads a group of 10 farmers in the Matete District of Kenya. 

Tomas has been farming with One Acre Fund since 2011. He joined the fund to get quality training and learn new farming methods. Although he describes his last harvest as very good, he believes he could do better this year by working alongside One Acre Fund.

Tomas wants to purchase a solar light with his loan, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation. He is very excited about the light, as it will allow his children to study during dark hours.

Obtaining this loan means that Tomas's Group can buy a total of five solar lights, as well as enough farming supplies to cover 7.25 acres of planting.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчон молодой парень в возрасте 27 лет проживающий в сельской местности он женат и имеет 2 детей на иждивении. Кобилчон занимается земледелием и выращивает зерновые культуры. Земледелие это основной источник его семейного дохода. Зимой когда не сезон для земледельцев он ездит в Россию на заработки. Там он работает на частных стройках наемным рабочим. Жена Кобилчона тоже выходит на поле помогать мужу в его работе. Вместе они стараются обеспечить своих детей всем необходимым, дать им достойное образование и помочь в их начинаниях. На данный момент он построил дом но закончить ему не удалось из за временных финансовых трудностей. Кобилчон решил обратится за поддержкой в "АРВАНД" и надеется ее получить. На полученные деньги он хочет купить и установить окна и двери из деревянных материалов. Кобилчон заранее благодарен организации за предоставление кредитных услуг малоимущим сельским жителям.
texts.en: Kobiljon is a young, 27-year-old man, living in a rural area. He is married and has 2 dependent children. Kobiljon is involved in farming and grows cereal crops. Farming is the sole source of income for his family. In the winter, during the off season for farmers, he goes to Russia for work. He works there on private constructions as a hired worker. Kobiljon's wife also goes to the field to help her husband with his work. Together, they try to provide everything necessary for their children, give them a decent education and help with their beginnings. At the present time, he is building a house, but cannot finish it due to temporary financial difficulties. Kobiljon decided to request support from Arvand and hopes to receive it. He wants to use this money to buy and install wood windows and doors. Kobiljon is grateful to the organization in advance for providing loan services to low-income rural residents.

loans.use: to buy and install wood windows and doors in order to finish building his house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old, married man who works in manufacturing aluminum windows, doors, and closets. His work is of a good quality, and most builders in the region deal with him because he has a good reputation.

In order to improve his business, Ahmad is requesting a youth loan from Al Majmoua to buy a generator that is necessary due to the unstable electricity in Lebanon. Ahmad works hard to improve his business and to increase his customer base. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a generator that is necessary due to the unstable electricity in Lebanon

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 25-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who opened a Cafe a year ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying his best to develop his business. Therefore, today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with new released coffees and other drinks to satisfy his customers' needs.

This loan will help Ismail make a step forward toward independence, as it will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with newly released coffees and other drinks to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Lara Group

texts.en:
Layla is the featured borrower for Lara Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and their living at the same time.

Layla is a 50-year-old married mother of three children who started preparing and selling food from her house. She has been doing this for two years to support her husband in satisfying their children's needs.

Layla is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a freezer in order to store more food.This loan will facilitate her business and provide her customers with quick service.

Layla is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Rola is the lady sitting in the middle, and Donia is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a freezer in order to store a greater quantity of food.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.en:
Akbarali is a generous man. He was born in the southern part of the country. He is living in a remote district with parents. He is single. He is a student. He is studying part-time. His major is finance and credit. He studies well and is active at classes. He is well-known among friends and students. 

In his free time, Akbarali is working as a cashier. He does not have enough money to pay tuition in his university. He wants to graduate well after his last year studies and get a good job. Akbarali has requested financial support to pay tuition of university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 45-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than four years now. Anita is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise as well as to buy animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business. In the future, Anita dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise as well as animal feed

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 5 children. He has a butcher shop in Nyahururu town and it has been profitable for the 20 years that he has been running the business. 

He will be using this loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of meat to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

This is his 3rd loan term and he paid back his previous loan successfully. In future Samuel hopes to expand his business and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 60 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children, all of whom are now adults. 

Esterlita is engaged in her food business making and selling “cotchinta” as her primary source of income. She's been doing this for 25 years already and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month. 

Esterlita has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations. 

Esterlita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to introduce her products to big supermarkets and stores.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 57 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children, 1 of whom is an adult while the other 2 are still in school. 

For 16 years, Lourdes has been engaged in agri-farming, specifically hog raising, and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Currently she has 8 piglets from her sow and 1 boar. 

Lourdes has requested a loan primarily to purchase booster feed for her hogs but also for her personal needs. 

Lourdes has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 3 years already. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase booster feed for her hogs and with her personal needs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard started farming in 2007, after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of his wife, who gifted his 1.6 acres, he has grown the business dramatically. He has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines and motorcycles, to help her run the farm. He keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. He takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Agriculture is fundamental to Kenya's economy. But it is much more than an economic activity. Farmers like Richard, 46, are stewards of Kenya’s countryside and provide the citizens with the option of buying locally-produced food. 

Richard is seeking a loan to purchase more land, as his operations are using up the available space. Profit from the investment will be plowed back into the business to finance more growth. The additional income will also help Richard repay the loan, buy food for his family, and pay fees for his children who are in public schools.

Richard feels blessed to have the support of his good-looking wife through all his undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Richard's dream closer to reality. Don't clip his wings, allow him to fly towards a better future and a better better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more land for farming

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 32 years old and married with four children. Three of them are in school. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store. She has been in this business for six years. 

Margarita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock, such as shampoo and grocery items, for sale. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a forty-nine-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop business where he earns a living along with farming. 

Peter started this business to be able to look after his family. His dream is to diversify his business so he can meet his customers' high demand. However, he faces the hardship of inadequate capital.

Peter intends to use his loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beer, soda, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beer, soda, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 42 years old, married and has five children, who are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business of farming flowering plants in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional variety and other materials for her business.

Mary Grace has been farming flowering plants for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety and other materials for her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Caroline, a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 16 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. With the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide for the basic needs of her parents. 

Caroline lives in the Kuserwo, Kapsowar, area of Kenya. The area has generally good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many, who regularly eat “Ugali“ (hard porridge) cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. 

The Kuserwo area has only one, diesel posho mill that is operated by Caroline and it serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down. Caroline intends to change this by buying new spare parts to permanently change this situation .She seeks a loan to repair her posho mill.

She hopes that through the loan the breakdowns will be few and far between. 

Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. Caroline sees herself established and running more than one posho mill, within the next two years. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to repair her posho mill

loans.name: Gulupa

texts.ru: Гулупа, досрочно погасила свой кретит, без нарушений. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Гулупы на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 7 овец, лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Гулупа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulupa repaid her previous loan ahead of time without any violations. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. She currently has three cows, seven sheep and a horse and earns 30,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her farm, she requested another loan from Bai-Tushum Bank, this time for 25,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to fatten and resell at the market for a higher price. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
Edward is a 56-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Edward has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Edward described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Edward’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Boaz's Group

texts.en:
Boaz is often described by his community as a very experienced farmer. He decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. Like many of his fellow farmers, Boaz also wanted to join the One Acre Fund community to get quality training and learn new farming methods.

Boaz has been a One Acre Fund member since 2010. Although he is the only person featured in the above picture, he represents a group of 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

This loan will help the whole group, who will receive enough maize seeds and fertilizer to plant six acres of land. Some members will also purchase solar lights, a total of eight altogether.

Boaz hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his nursery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives happily in Kapan, in Syunik region of Armenia, with his nice family. He has two beautiful daughters; the elder is a student and the smallest is still school-aged. His wife works as a nurse at the city’s medical center.

Armen was graduated from the department of folk instruments of his college. He then worked at his specialty at the college.
