After working at a few other places on different specialties, he began work at the city's electricity supply network as an engineer. He now needs financial support and he greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help him.

Armen has requeted a Kiva loan to pay for his mother's medical examination and possible surgery. Armen will be so thankful if Kiva lenders can help him support the most treasured and beloved person in his life, his lovely mother.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's medical costs.

loans.name: Florrabel

texts.en: Florrabel is a 42-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. Florrabel has raised pigs for more than 3 years now. She also runs a small sari-sari, or retail store business, selling rice, canned goods, noodles and other goods. As of now, Florrabel is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, animal feed, and additional stock to sell (such as rice, canned goods, noodles, etc.). A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business and her store. In the future, Florrabel dreams of improving her livelihood. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, animal feed, and additional stock to sell (such as rice, canned goods, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married male aged 38 and lives in Kagadi, Uganda with 4 children, and this is where he earns from an art and design business and a piggery project to get an income.

However honest Peter is, he is challenged by bad debtors affecting his returns. He desires to improve his piggery project.

He is asking for a loan to buy paint and paste to aid him in his arts and crafts shop.

loans.use: to buy paint and paste to aid him in his arts and crafts shop

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Dairy farming is more of a passion than a business for Doreen. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2008. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Gikui, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of three lovely children.

For the past six years she has been making a small living by practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business or “side hustle,” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income.

Doreen passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing capital to grow her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan, and she used it to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training, and the impact of the first loan must not be underestimated.

Now Doreen is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, and Kiva lenders, to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The animal she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow capable of producing between 15 and 20 liters of milk per day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means the cow will be making 11 USD worth of milk per day.

From this loan, the life of Doreen will permanently change, and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Doreen waits for your kindness. Her farm will be maintained and go from strength to strength, with your help!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kyempara Women Group 1

texts.en:
Faith is 50 years old, a hard-working married woman, with eight children, a member of the Kyempara Women Group 1. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been in the business of retailing general merchandise for five years. She also gets additional income from her government salary. Faith started her business to look after her family and also not to depend on the government salary that in most cases comes late.

She has a dream of educating  her children. However, she is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital. 

Faith is in need of a loan to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Drande

texts.en:
Drande is a 57-year-old villager who is married; her three children are all on their own. Drande has applied for a loan to buy some materials to build a shed where she can put the agricultural products and the tools that she uses in her daily activities. 

Drande owns about 25 dynym agricultural land where she planted 300 olive trees about three years back; they haven’t produced anything yet because it takes roughly four years to start producing.  Additionally, she has two goats, as seen in the photograph and three pigs and plants seasonal veggies. She keeps all her products for her family. Her husband works as a security guard and she receives a disability pension.

loans.use: to build a shed where she can store her agricultural and livestock products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some electrical installments to their little house

loans.name: Peris's Group

texts.en:
Peris is a 30-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Peris has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Peris described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Peris’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Suglo N Bori Buni Sagnarigu Kukuo Group

texts.en:
Ayishetu is a 60-year-old hardworking woman from Sagnarigu-Kukoo in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has two children. Ayishetu is the individual pictured with her hand raised among members squatting.

Ayishetu is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 30 years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo N Bori Buni Sagnarigu Kukuo’. She earns a good profit from the business simply because of the long standing experience she gained from the group in processing high quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian local markets.

Ayishetu and ‘Suglo N Bori Buni Sagnarigu Kukuo’ group have asked for a loan of GHS 16,250. Ayishetu’s share of the loan is GHS 600 which will be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. She aspires to produce in large quantities in the future and earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food stuffs and pay her health insurance premiums.

Ayishetu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Sara 9 Group

texts.en:
Eman is the featured borrower for Sara 9 Group. She got together with the other members of the group to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Eman is a 45-year-old Syrian married mother of two children who has been employed at a company for a year. She earns a limited salary to support her husband in providing for their children's needs.

Eman is trying hard to improve her living conditions; thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business selling cosmetics as a second source of income.

In the photo, Eman is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Zoubaida is the second lady on the left, Abir is the second lady on the right, and Enaam is the first lady on the right.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Pelinda

texts.en:
Lenders! The above picture presents to you Pelinda, a very hardworking mother and ambitious go-getter who is 26 years of age and hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, a rural town near the famous Rift valley escarpment of Kenya. Together with her handsome husband, they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been good. She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Kapsowar area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking kindly for a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Pelinda is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around. Lenders kindly don't clip her wings; allow her to fly towards a better future and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a fifty-four-year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income alongside farming where he earns more income. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He has personal goals of educating his children and becoming a prominent business man. His main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is a hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is farming alongside cattle rearing and selling. He started this business to increase on his income and look after his family.  He has hardships of lack of capital and price fluctuations; however he has a vision of owning a well known and advanced farm. 

Aggrey will use the loan to buy more cows for rearing and selling at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing and selling at his farm.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz, es una creativa, responsable, versátil mujer del campo, tiene 49 años de edad y es la orgullosa madre de 3 hijos los cuales quiere brindarles lo que nunca tuvo, una educación, por su condiciones de pobreza en niñez no puedo acceder a una escuela y ahora hace hasta lo imposible trabajando largas jornadas laborales para que sus hijos tengan esta bella y preciada oportunidad.
Tanto su casa como su tienda son hechas de madera, pero el objetivo para dos años es construirla en material.
Luz quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, como frijol, café, productos de panadería, refrescos, arroz, dulces, etc.
texts.en:
Luz is a creative, responsible, versatile rural woman. She is 49 years old and is the proud mother of 3 children, whom she wants to provide with what she never had -- an education. Due to conditions of childhood poverty, she never had access to school. Now she does everything, including working long days, so that her children can have this beautiful and precious opportunity.

Her house as well as her store are made of wood, but the goal in two years is to build it out of a stronger material.

Luz wants to apply for a loan to buy basic family needs such as beans, coffee, bread products, soft drinks, rice, sweets, etc.

loans.use: to buy food such as beans, coffee, soft drinks, rice, baked goods, sweets, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosa De La Paz

texts.es:
Rosa de 50 años de edad, solo estudió primer grado, no pudo continuar por diversos motivos y el más común la situación económica de su familia, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, no tienen hijos solo ellos viven en casa   
 
Rosa es costurera desde hace 19 años, ella aprendió de su madre porque también se dedicaba a este oficio y decidió esta actividad porque le gusta y se satisface al ver sus creaciones puesta en sus clientes, aparte de eso ella es ama de casa, atiende a su esposo, cuida de gallinas, cerdos, patos, pavos, entre otros, ella elabora todo en su casa por lo cual no tiene que dirigirse hacia ningún lado y su esposo le ayuda siempre que es necesario.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar zíperes, hilos, botones y ganchos para su trabajo de costura, también comprará el medicamentos para su salud. 

Ella siempre ha soñado con montar una academia donde pueda enseñarles sus conocimientos a otras personas que estén interesadas en dicha profesión, además sueña con ver su casa en buen estado.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old, she only studied up to first grade. She wasn't able to continue for various reasons, the biggest one being her family's financial situation. She is married and her husband works in bricklaying. They have no children and they live alone in their house. 

Rosa has been a seamstress for 19 years. She learned from her mother, who used to work in the same profession. She decided to do this kind of work because she likes it and finds it satisfying to see her creations being worn by her customers. Besides this, she is a housewife, she looks after her husband and keeps hens, pigs, ducks, turkeys and other animals. She does all her dressmaking from home so she doesn't have to travel anywhere and her husband always helps her when necessary. 

She needs this loan to buy zippers, thread, buttons and hooks for her work as a seamstress, she will also buy medicines for her health. She has always dreamed of setting up a school where she could pass on her knowledge to other people interested in the profession. She also dreams of seeing her house in a nice condition.

loans.use: to buy zippers, thread, buttons and hooks for her work as a seamstress, she will also buy medicines for her health.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate the bathroom and kitchen from inside.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol es madre soltera y tiene un bebe de 8 meses Marisol es granjera y planta maiz Marisol vive con sus padres pero ellos solamente le dan vivienda. Marisol quiere expandir su negocio, ella quiere plantar flores por lo que necesita un prestamo para comprar semillas Marisol quiere ser independiente y mudarse a su propia casa, ademas ella tambien quiere tener su propia tierra para plantar semillas
texts.en: Marisol is the single mother of an 8-month-old baby, and lives with her parents. Her mother and father can provide a home, but Marisol also needs to earn a living, so she's a small farmer, growing corn and turnips on her parents' land. Marisol would like to diversify the farm, so she's planning to start growing flowers and is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds. Marisol would like to boost production on her farm, become independent, and buy her own land to farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Jane. She lives in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, renowned for producing long distance elite runners who have broken world records in the Olympics.

Jane is a loving mother and has been in the agricultural business for 14 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. Jane has been relying on agriculture to make all of her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Jane remains positive and passionate about her economic activity.

Jane is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. A poultry farm is cheaper to run, and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Jane will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profit.

An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Jane’s economic activity and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry

loans.name: Ciciliah

texts.en:
Ciciliah is a woman of character and good intentions. She has goals of progressing and going forward with her family. She is from Kericho, a remote town in Kenya. She has spent the last five years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. 

Ciciliah is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to feed her animals. Ciciliah wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With the loan, Ciciliah will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan and allow her to save extra money. Ciciliah is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking, married man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his gardens and still practices farming as his main source of income, alongside livestock production and sorghum selling as his side-income businesses. He started this business to earn a living and look after his family. He still faces a challenge of price fluctuations, that lead to a low market for his products, but hopes that his business will improve to better standards and that he will be able to build a permanent house using his proceeds.

He is requesting a loan to buy seedlings for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for his gardens

loans.name: Adrine

texts.en: Adrine is a 32-year-old female married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Adrine is a health worker by profession and also operates a retail shop of general merchandise to get additional income. She has a dream of finishing her residential house. However, she is faced with the challenge of low and delayed salary payments. Adrine needs a loan to buy cement and sand for construction.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear

loans.name: Melba

texts.es: Melba: Es una señora jovial, es promotora comunitaria voluntaria de la comunidad miskita Kuakuil 2. Esta comunidad pertenece al municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se localiza a 85 kms. de Bilwi. Ella  es agricultora y también realiza  actividades pecuarias.  Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos: Dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de tres años de edad.  Es muy activa, por eso ha participado en varias capacitaciones, en temas de abono orgánico, manejo integral de cultivos, que han impartido PANA PANA, quien le otorgó un certificado como promotora de mejoramiento de vida. El préstamo que ella está solicitando es para invertirlo en la crianza y engorde de cerdo que después comercializará en Bilwi;  Su sueño es tener una finca con cultivos diversificados, con buenos rendimientos y manejo agronómico, que le generen buenos ingresos también, para crear mejores condiciones para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Melba is a jovial woman, she is a  community support volunteer in the Miskito town, Kuakuil 2. The town belongs to the municipality of Puerto Cabezas and is 85km [52 miles] from Bilwi. 

She is a farmer and she is also involved in the livestock business. She is 39 years old and is a single mother with 3 children: two teenagers at school and a little one who is three years old. She is very active and has participated in  various training courses on organic fertilizer and comprehensive crop management given by PANA PANA, who awarded her a certificate as a facilitator for life improvement.

The loan that she is requesting is for investing in the breeding and fattening of pigs that she will then sell in Bilwi. Her dream is to have a farm with a diversity of crops, good yields and agronomic management, which will also generate a good income for her in order to create better conditions for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the breeding and fattening of pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Middy's Group

texts.en:
Middy is 30 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Middy has been farming with One Acre Fund for four years, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Middy also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Middy's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nasara Nyohini Group

texts.en:
Fatimata is a 62-year-old, hard-working woman from Tamale-Nyohini in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has two children. Fatimata is the individual pictured with her hand raised, among members squatting.

Fatimata is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 30 years. The name of the group is ‘Nasara Nyohini’. She earns a good profit from the business simply because she has long-standing experience in processing high-quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian local markets. 

Fatimata and the ‘Nasara Nyohini' group have asked for a loan of 15,800 GHS. Fatimata’s share of the loan is 500 GHS, which would be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. She aspires to produce in large quantities in the future and earn more income. She also aspires to repay this loan, support her family with foodstuffs, and pay for her children's educational expenses.

Fatimata thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and piping etc. in order to build a bathroom with a shower.

loans.name: Lorohuachana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOROHUACHANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rina Angelica ella es conviviente y tiene 70 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio prmiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "LOROHUACHANA" all live in the district of Quellouno, which is in the department of Cuzco.

Rina Angelica is one of these members. She is 70 years old and has three children. She earns a living by growing fruit. She has her own fields where she grows plantains, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6am to 5pm and has many years of experience. Everything is going well for her and her dream is to expand her business and purchase more land. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

The other members of the group sell animals, work in agriculture, have a grocery store and sell food.

Rina Angelica thanks everyone who has helped her to achieve her dream and she promises to make on time payments as established with the loan.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Villa San Blas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA SAN BLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Macaria ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,pollo,carne y verduras.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo y no pudieron llegar a tiempo a la reunion.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The partners are members of the communal bank "Villa San Blas"; this bank is located in the Cusco district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

The requesting partner is Señora Macaria. She is single, 42 years old and has 6 children. She works in her restaurant, preparing different meals such as chicken and potatoes, soups, and chipped beef. She is an entrepreneurial woman thanks to this business, and wants her children to complete their studies. She works from 10 a.m. until 5 p.m., and has worked in this business for 7 years, which is going very well. Her dream is to improve the restaurant's business. She asks this loan to buy food ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The partners glued to the group picture took their photos after the meeting because they gained permission for work reasons and they were not able to get in time to the meeting

The other partners work different businesses, including the sale of vegetables, the sale of animals, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Llapallanchis Llankasunchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPALLANCHIS LLANKASUNCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Llapallanchis Llankasunchis" communal bank, which is located in the district and province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.

Sabina, 43, is single and has two children. She works in a business selling cereals. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a property where she can sell cereals. She is applying for a loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo took their photos after the meeting. They asked for permission for work-related reasons.

The other members' businesses include animal sales, cereals sales, a grocery store, and food sales.

This borrower is grateful to those who make up part of her dream through this platform. She is committed to complying with her installment payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German tiene 68 años de edad, es casado, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, esta habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a prestar servicio de mantenimiento de vehículos y maquinaria pesada, cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de insumos y herramientas para realizar trabajos en su taller, con esto German espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
German is 68 years old and is married. He lives with his wife in their own home, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru. Life in this district is quiet. Its inhabitants are respectful people, who work in commerce, farming, and ranching.

German makes a living providing maintenance services for vehicles and heavy machinery. He has more than 20 years of experience in this business and has good personal and work references in the area. 

He will use the loan to buy supplies and tools to use in his garage. With this purchase, German hopes to offer a better service to his customers, which will allow him to generate more income and, thus, improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tools to use in his garage.

loans.name: Gathungu

texts.en:
Gathungu sells cereals in Nakuru town and has been in this business for 25 years. He is 56 years old, married and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with four children. 

He will be using this loan to buy energy saving cook stoves. This will assist him in reducing the need to buy charcoal and it is also environmentally friendly. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to buy more stock of cereals for sale.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to expand his business and also invest in farming.

loans.use: to buy energy saving cook stoves.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Caroline, a farmer from a remote village in Cheptuiyet in the Kericho area of Kenya. She resides with her handsome husband, with whom she is blessed with a lovely family. 

Caroline has been actively involved in farming for the past 12 years and has never regretted it or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and which lay more eggs. 

Caroline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She will use the excess maize she has to feed her poultry, and she will feed them sorghum to give them energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate into more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, Caroline will increase her output of poultry meat, and this will also increase her income and profit margins. 

With increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. In addition to better profits, Caroline is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will then save more money by not having to buy fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to this family because Caroline will be able to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Yoneda

texts.en:
Yoneda is a 36-year-old female. She is single with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She operates a produce business, concentrating on beans and maize. She has been in that business since 2004. 

Yoneda began the business to look after her family, after separating from her husband. She is working hard to achieve her goal of expanding her business and educating her children to university level. However, she is faced with a challenge of market competition. 

Yoneda intends to use this loan to buy beans to sell. Her business is showing a positive trend and profits have increased.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, tiene un negocio en el  que vende pupusas, meriendas, refrescos, gaseosas y jugos, trabaja de manera independiente de seis y media de la mañana a una de la tarde, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades y tiene una experiencia de más de 20 años en el negocio; vive con su compañero de vida, en los documentos legales su estado civil es soltera, sus tres hijos ya ya son totlamente independientes.
El préstamo será de ayuda para poder comprar harina, maíz, quesillo, aceite, tomates, cebollas, azúcar, bebidas, etc., tendrá materia prima para elaborar la su venta, así dará un buen servicio a sus clientes y aumentara sus ganancias, espera seguir trabajando y atraer nuevos clientes.
Sus sueños son continuar ampliando su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María has a store selling pupusas, snacks, refreshments, sodas, and juices.  She works independently from 6:30 AM until 1:00 PM.  She hasn't had any difficulties and has been operating the business for 20 years.  She lives with her partner and her three children no longer depend on her.   
The loan is to buy flour, corn, quesillo, oil, tomatoes, onions, sugar, etc. as raw materials for making her food.  In this way she'll be able to provide a good service for her clients and increase her profits.  She hopes to keep working and attract new clients.  Her dream is to keep expanding her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, quesillo, oil, tomatoes, onions, sugar, etc. as raw materials for making her food.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a forty-five-year old male married with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  Wilson has owned a textile shop for twenty years. He also deals in poultry and crop growing to supplement his income. He has a dream of making a wholesale shop dealing in clothes. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Wilson is requesting this loan to buy shirts, trousers, skirts and children wear for selling.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, skirts and children wear for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and supplies to continue making her recipes such as chicken, flour, and cheese.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a 49-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joyce has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Joyce described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Joyce’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Teresina's Group

texts.en:
Teresina is 44 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Teresina has been farming with One Acre Fund four years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Teresina also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Teresina's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer casada de 36 años, tiene una bonita familia de 5 hijos todos ellos están estudiando en una escuelita de su comunidad, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Lucía es una mujer que apoya a su familia para que tengan lo necesario, pues para la generación de sus ingresos, ella trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando papa, arveja, zanahoria entre otras verduras, Lucía a pesar de que no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir en la escuela, pues ella a través de sus conocimientos adquirido con sus padres, puede sobrevivir,  y con esto ella ayuda a su esposo en las aspiraciones para la prosperidad de su familia. Pues para seguir sembrando ella necesita capital de trabajo para  comprar más semillas y fertilizantes, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un crédito de tres mil quetzales para sufragar todos estos gastos. 
Lucía no es conformista con un solo trabajo, ella en los tiempos libres o por las noches se dedica a la elaboración de artículos con mostacilla es otra manera de cómo generar más ingresos, Lucía tiene expectativas de conseguir el prestamo, para generar más ingresos y el sueño de esta mujer es darle un buen futuro a sus hijos apoyándolos en seguir estudiando hasta llegar hacer profesionales.
texts.en:
Lucía is a 36 year-old married woman. She has a beautiful family with 5 children, all of whom are studying in a small school in the community. They live in a community in Sololá. 

Lucía is a woman who supports her family so that they have what they need. To make her income she works in farming, planting potatoes, peas, carrots and other vegetables. Although Lucía didn't have the opportunity to go to school, through the knowledge acquired from her parents she is able to survive. In this way she helps her husband with the goal of prosperity for the family. In order to continue planting she needs working capital to buy more seeds and fertilizers. For this reason she is asking for a loan of three thousand GTQ ($400) to cover all these costs. 

Lucía is not a conformist with just one job. In her free time or at night she makes items out of beads as another means of making more money. Lucía is hopeful that she will get the loan to make more income. Her dream is to give her children a good future, supporting them so they can continue studying until they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Olga Biviana

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer casada tiene 2 hijos  comprendido entre las edades de 10 y 6 años Olga tiene 29 años, y junto a su familia viven en una comunidad de Solola 

Olga para generar sus ingresos, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes esto lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive, esta actividad lo aprendió desde pequeña ya que sus padres se dedicaban a este tipo de actividad, Pues Olga se casó y logro también instalar su negocio, pues con los ingresos ella apoya al esposo  para alcanzar otras metas, pues ahora Olga necesita  comprar un terreno para tener un espacio donde construir una casa para que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde vivir para una mejor comodidad, la dificultad es que ella no tiene dinero para hacer la compras, es por eso que ella está buscando un prestamo  y con las ganancias de su negocio ella estaría  pagando el prestamo, ya que los prestamos son medios que nos sirvan para alcanzar nuestras metas.  Olga tiene expectativas de conseguir el prestamo.
texts.en:
Olga is a married woman with two children between the ages of ten and six.  Olga is 29 years old and lives with her family in the community of Soloa.  To earn money she works buying and selling groceries in the community where she lives.  She learned this activity as a child as her parents worked in this business.  

Olga married and also managed to establish her business.  With her income she supports her husband so he can reach other goals.  Now Olga needs to purchase land in order to have a place to build a house so that her children have a more comfortable place to live.  The problem is that she doesn't have money to make the purchases for the store.  This is why she is looking for a loan.  With the earnings from her business she will be paying the loan. The loans are a manner that allow people to reach their goals.  Olga is hoping to receive the loan.

loans.use: to purchase land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quantity of freah fish to offer for sale at the market

loans.name: Francis Group

texts.en:
Francis is a 60-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Francis has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Francis described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Francis’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Pius W Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Pius W., often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 43 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere Distric, Kenya.  He is married and has 4 children.

Pius W. is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Pius W. says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Pius W. will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jescah's Group

texts.en:
Jescah's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Jescah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 54 years old, is married and has 3 children. Jescah has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Jescah isn't new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Jescah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Jescah's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Gregorio De Jesus

texts.es: Gregorio de Jesús: Es un señor agricultor de 37 años de edad, casado, con 4 hijos adolescentes, actualmente no estudian debido a problemas económicos y por la distancia de la escuela. Él vive con su familia en una finca ubicada montaña adentro de la comunidad de Columbus. Solicita su primer financiamiento para sembrar dos manzanas de frijoles. Su sueño es contar con una producción diversificada y mejorar sus rendimientos y calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio de Jesús is a 37 year old farmer, married with 4 teenage children, who are not currently attending school due to economic problems and the distance to and from school.
He lives with his family in a mountain farm in the community of Columbus. He is requesting his first loan to plant beans in an area of two blocks. 
His dream is to have a diversified production to improve his returns and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: plant beans in a two block area.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a married woman with three adult children. Eugenia and her husband live in a private house.

Evgenia served in the military before she retired and became a housewife. Her husband has a part time job. Evgenia is a honest, hardworking, and open person. Eugenia and her husband are currently renovating their house.  She requests 16 000 UAH to buy a wood-fired boiler for their home heating system. The loan will help the family to heat the house with wood and save money on gas during the winter season.

loans.use: to buy a wood-fired boiler for her home heating system.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban esta trabajando con un ingeniero desde hace 2 años , vive con sus padres, a la par que trabaja también esta estudiando la carrera de ingeniería electrónica.
Sus metas futuras son la de recibirse e independizarse,seguir estudiando para obtener mejores  ingresos y  ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su matricula de universidad.
texts.en:
Esteban has been working with an engineer for 2 years. He lives with his parents and he works whilst studying for a degree in electrical engineering.      

His goals for the future are: to receive his degree and become independent and to carry on studying in order to obtain a better income and help his family. 

He is asking for this loan to pay for his university tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo. She owns a store selling bathroom and plumbing equipment, fitments, and accessories. Andrea doesn't have any hired employees. She has been running this business for 10 years. 

Andrea is seeking additional funding of 40,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of merchandise and stock their vending location with boilers, sewer pipe drains, and blending devices. 

She is a hard worker; however, this difficult time in Ukraine has caused much uncertainty and currency fluctuations which subsequently affected her business as well.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise and stock their vending location with boilers, sewer pipe drains and blending devices

loans.name: El Wafaa Kayfoun Group

texts.en:
Manal is the featured borrower for El Wafaa Kayfoun Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Manal is a 37-year-old married mother of two children who has worked as a cosmetics saleswoman for six years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Manal is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics, as she wants to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Manal is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Noha is the lady standing in the middle, and Suzan is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Flor De Retama De Rumira Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FLOR DE RETAMA DE RUMIRA, el banco está ubicado en  el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jasinta continua dedicándose al  negocio de restaurante, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua elaborando diversos platos como saltados,sopas,estofados entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, carnes, menestras entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales menores, tienda de abarrotes, transporte.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Flor De Retama De Rumira". The bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, department of Cusco. 

The member, Jasinta continues to make a living at her restaurant business. She is grateful for the loan she has been given and is committed to complying with the established repayments. She continues to produce diverse dishes such as sautéed meats, soups and stews amongst others. She is a responsible and persevering person and in this way she make her family get ahead. This member is asking for a loan in order to purchase supplies such as oil, meats and vegetable stews amongst others. 

The other members work in agriculture, breeding animals, grocery stores, and transport.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as oil, meats and vegetable stews amongst others.

loans.name: María Janeth

texts.es:
Portoviejo es capital de la Provincia de Manabí a 35 km de la ciudad de Manta. Está ubicada a pocos minutos de la playa de Crucita, donde se puede estar en contacto con la naturaleza y disfrutar del sol y de sus tranquilas olas.  Con su clima cálido seco.
La señora Janeth tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos 25, 18, 8 y 3 años,  el segundo y tercero estudian en el colegio y la escuela, el esposo trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada en una empresa privada, ellos tienen casa propia.
Doña Janeth con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa por catálogo, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, da crédito y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace catoce años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
El Crédito que le fue otorgado es para invertir encompras de  productos que son solicitados por sus clientes (perfumes, ropa y productos de belleza).  Tiene diez años haciendo los créditos, le gusta el apoyo que le  ha dado la fundación con los créditos y los bajos intereses.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí province, 35 km from the city of Manta. It is located a few minutes from Crucita beach, where one can be in touch with nature and enjoy the sun and the peaceful waves. It has a warm, dry climate. 

Janeth is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 25, 18, 8 and 3. The second and third are students in secondary school and primary school. Her husband works as a heavy machinery operator in a private business. They have their own house.

Janeth, with the end of having her own income, works selling catalog products from Avon, Esika, Yanbal (beauty products, makeup, perfumes, and ladies' accessories) and clothing by catalog. She works every day, mostly in the morning since at that time it is easier to make her rounds. She sells door-to-door, gives credit and collects weekly. She has been doing this for fourteen years, in which it has gone very well for her since she has a sizable customer base. She sells the most of cosmetics and perfume.

The loan that was granted to her is to invest in purchases of products that are requested by her customers (perfumes, clothing, and beauty products). She has been getting loans for ten years, and she likes the support that the foundation has given her with the loans and low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, clothing and beauty products.

loans.name: Viky Veronica

texts.es:
Viky Veronica tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en una zona rural en el distrito de Bolivar, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la ganadería, comercio y agricultura.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de fotocopias e impresiones, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su lugar de trabajo y sus equipos ya que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado, con esto Viky Veronica espera tener en mejores condiciones sus máquinas y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Viki Veronica is 29 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her family in a rural section of the District of Bolivar in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district engage primarily in livestock breeding, trade, and agriculture.

Viki Veronica offers photocopying and printing services. Her business is located inside of her home. She has more than five years of experience in this business and also has very good personal and work-related references who are from this area.

Viki Veronica is requesting a loan in order to repair and maintain her workplace, as well as her equipment which is in bad condition. With this loan, she hopes to have machines that are in better condition so that she can provide better service to her customers. This will make a positive impact on her income level, which will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her workplace, as well as her equipment which is in bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Africano

texts.en:
Africano is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle rearing and selling as his main source of income alongside farming and running a pork joint. It is from these businesses that he has been able to meet his family needs and take care of his schooling children. He faces a challenge of lack of capital; however, he hopes to become a permanent businessman.

He has asked for a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Agripina's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Agripina, who, as a group leader, is representing her group, formed by 15 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children, and is known by her community as a very friendly person.

Initially, Agripina joined One Acre Fund in 2010, because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Agripina plans to send her children to school.

Between the 15 farmers in Agripina's Group, a total of 11.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the maize harvest.

loans.name: Emma Fabiola

texts.es: A sus 51 años de edad Fabiola es una señora divorciada, tiene 6 hijos mismos de los cuales 4 viven con ella y también 2 nietos, la casa en donde Fabiola vive es de su hijo y en este lugar construyo un corral  de tablas para criar sus chanchos, Fabiola también se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajos de campo, Fabiola necesita el créditopara invertirlo en la compra de chanchos y con este negocio aspira mejorarlo y seguir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en: 51-year-old Fabiola is divorced. She has six children. Four of her children live with her, as well as two grandchildren. The house in which Fabiola lives belongs to her son. She built a pen there out of boards for raising her pigs in. Fabiola also works as a day laborer in the field. She needs the loan in order to invest it in buying pigs. She hopes to improve her business and get ahead in life with her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Elika's Group

texts.en:
Elika's Group consists of 11 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Elika, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 32 years old, is married and has four children. Elika has been a farmer for 11 years and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Elika isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014, and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farm training. 

This year, Elika will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Using this loan, Elika's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming supplies received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the maize harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for his plants.

loans.name: Dinnani  Sagnarigu-Kukuo Group

texts.en:
Abibata is a 60-year-old hard working woman from Sagnarigu-Kukoo which is in the Northern region of Ghana. Abibata is married and has 6 children. Abibata is the individual pictured in the first row with her hand raised.

Abibata is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for 15 years. The name of the group is ‘Dinnani  Sagnarigu-Kukuo’. She earns a good profit from the business because the group was trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian market, especially around Tamale.

Abibata and ‘Dinnani  Sagnarigu-Kukuo’ group have asked for a loan of 8,100.00 GHS. Abibata’s share of the loan is 400.00 GHS which would be used to buy paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing. Abibata aspires to produce large quantities  and earn more income.  That will enable her to repay this loan and support her family with food and education.

Abibata thanks Kiva lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from local rice farmers.

loans.name: Buana

texts.en: Buana is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handmade jewelry. He would like to purchase bulk quantities of gemstones and silver for his designs. Buana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: I was born in Gianyar, a regency in Bali which is known throughout the world for its beautiful landscape and art. I've been surrounded by handicrafts all my life. In 1990 I decided to learn how to make silver jewelry from a friend in Celuk. I am thankful to God for giving me such a great gift so I can make a living for my family. Not much, perhaps, but enough for our simple way of life. Many thanks for your support. Previous loans have helped me to increase sales and hire more artisans at my workshop. I hope this new microcredit can improve my small business even more. Use the link below to view Buana's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5503

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of gemstones and silver for his designs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  es un hombre de 64 años, vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá, él tiene 6 hijos.
Pedro es un hombre que se esmera en trabajar, para dar todo lo necesario para su familia, pues para la generación de sus ingresos desde hace cuatro años él viene trabajando como guardián en un chalet eligió esta actividad porque lo realiza ahí en su comunidad.
 Pues para complementar sus ingresos pedro también se dedica a la agricultura, también lo realiza ahí en su comunidad, pero con estos ingresos no es suficiente satisfacer otras necesidades para el bienestar de sus hijos, para alcanzar otras metas es necesario buscarle otras salidas, pues una de las necesidades de este señor es comprar un lote de terreno para sembrar maíz, entonces para lograr, él solicita un prestamo de  once mil quetzales, para realizar esta compra,  a través del prestamo él alcanza esta meta, pues con los ingresos que genera sus dos actividades podrá pagar el prestamo poco a poco. Las metas de Pedro es adquirir terrenos  para que más adelante les conceda  a sus hijos como herencia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 64 year old man with six children. He lives together with his family in a community called Solalá.

Pedro strives to succeed in his work, especially so he can provide everything his family needs. His income for the past four years has come from his work as a guard at a villa. He chose to pursue this because its within his community. In order to complement and enhance his income, Pedro also makes a living in agriculture. He does this activity in his community, however, his income is still not enough to support his family's well being. So, to attain these goals, he has found it necessary to invest in other outlets, such as buying a plot of land and plant corn. 

Therefore, he is asking for this loan to buy eleven thousand quetzales in order to go through with this purchase. The loan will allow him to reach his goals, and, because he has an income from two different activities, he will be able to pay off his loan little by little. His ultimate goal is to acquire even more land that he can eventually give to his children as inheritance.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Lete

texts.en:
Lete is a villager and a 58-year-old married woman with a 28-year-old son. She seeks your financial help to buy a milk cow. 

For the past 24 years, her focus has been on what she knew best, which is  agriculture and livestock.  She sells 40kg of cottage cheese each month, 12 kg of salted butter per month, and two baby calves a year.  She  owns 1.5 hectare agricultural land to plant fodder and corn. She uses corn for her two cows and the baby calves, but she also sells part of it. She keeps the fodder for the animals. Beans, peppers and tomatoes are some of the seasonal veggies that she  plants. This is how she earns her living. Her son works in a shoe factory operated by Italian investors and earns $200/month. He sends his  parents half of his earnings. 

Lete’s parents in-law live with them and have a pension of about $112/month.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is a small-food-service entrepreneur from Vinogradovo. She runs a nice little cafeteria offering meals and drinks to people in her home town. 

Svitlana remembers how hard it was to launch this business and start everything from scratch. However, she never regretted her daring endeavor. Today she has loyal clientele and a cozy place where people love to come to grab something to eat. 

Svitlana has made plans to buy a new inexpensive coffee machine, prepacked processed products and vegetables, and various coffee drinks, as well as make some minor repairs in her cafe to attract more clients while it is still cold outside and there are few things to do out. 

Svitlana needs additional 31,000 Grivnyas to implement her plans, meet growing demand, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new inexpensive coffee machine, prepacked processed products and vegetables, and various coffee drinks, as well as make some minor repairs in her cafe to attract more clients

loans.name: Taras

texts.en:
Taras is from Vinogradovo. He has already used financial assistance from Kiva and his business has benefited from it. Taras's business income had a 2,000 Grivnya increase. Moreover, recently his wife's maternity leave ended and she went back to work again. 

This time Taras is seeking a loan of 35,000 Grivnyas to buy raw materials to manufacture window blinds, roll-down doors and gates, as well as buy plastic for suspended ceilings.  Taras has recently received a few nice orders which is why he needs additional funds to supply his business with materials to comply with his customers' expectations.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture window blinds, roll-down doors and gates, as well as buy plastic for suspended ceilings

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 38 years of age, has made his living selling shoes for the past 10 years. His business is located near his house in a very trafficked area, which is why he has a lot of customers. With what he earns, he is able to cover some household expenses.

Jose lives in his own home with his wife. He is applying for a loan to buy shoes wholesale in order to be able to have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда проживает в районе А.Джоми с мамой, сестренкой и маленькими детьми. Она замужем, ее муж находится за приделами страны на заработках. Мавлуде 25 лет. Она ответственная и талантливая женщина в жизни. Мавлуда давно хотела научиться кроить и сшить женскую одежду. Она четыре года назад начала заниматься шитьем женской одежды. В швейном деле ей помогает сестренка. Она занимается у себя дома. Ее нынешняя швейная машинка не исполняет свои функции хорошо. Мавлуда принимает кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку и продолжить продвигаться дальше. Только Вы можете помочь Мавлуде с финансовыми трудностями. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in the A. Jomi district with her mother, sister and small children. She is married, and her husband works abroad. Mavluda is 25 years old. She is a responsible and talented woman in her life. Mavluda has wanted to learn how to cut and sew women's clothing for a long time. She got involved in sewing women's clothing four years ago. Her sister helps her with the sewing business. Mavluda runs her business from home. Her current sewing machine does not perform its functions well. Mavluda is requesting this loan to buy a new sewing machine and continue advancing her business. Only You can help Mavluda with financial difficulties. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Imelda Yasmin

texts.es: Imelda de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 16 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Imelda is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. Since she was 16, she has made a living making clothes. Her workshop is located in her home, and she has many clients because of the quality with which she makes her clothes. With the earnings from her job, she manages to solve some of the household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase thread, needles, a variety of textiles, buttons, elastics, etc. and that way continue with her job, which generates good profits.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, a variety of textiles, buttons, elastics, etc...

loans.name: Jockim

texts.en: Jockim is a thirty-five-year-old honest, married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Jockim is a teacher by profession. He also runs a retail shop of general merchandise in order to increase his families' income. He has been in that profession for ten years and he likes it. Jockim has a dream of improving his families' lively hood. His biggest challenge is the long distance to his work place. Jockim is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, soap and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Arastasi

texts.en:
Arastus is a married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Arastus operates a retail shop for the sale of general merchandise. He also owns a mobile money business in order to earn a living. 

Arastus is requesting a loan to buy land in order to achieve his dream. He faces a hardship of market competition. But he is very determined to take his business to greater heights.

loans.use: to buy land for settlement.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers, a 28-year-old married man, with 3 children started a retail shop, bar and butchery. He started the shop to get returns and grow his business for self sustainability in Kagadi, Uganda. He is hard working for the survival of his businesses and family. He is challenged by delayed payments from debtors. Rogers intends to use this loan to buy beer, sodas, sugar and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, sugar and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Mercy. She is a smallholder farmer from Nkubu, in the central region of Kenya. Mercy owns a one-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. She keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She also has a side business of transporting people, using her Indian motorbike (called "Boda-Boda," locally). She has five years of experience in farming.

Mercy is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations, like Juhudi Kilimo, support farmers like Mercy. Through a group of 15 members called Njoe Gikuru, Mercy has access to loans from Juhudi Kilimo. They use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Mercy, because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Joyce. Joyce, 37, is a very dedicated mother who believes in hard work. She is happily married and blessed with three lovely children, whom she often refers to as “my pride.” 

Joyce is based in Nkubu, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. For the past ten years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income is from milk and crop farming. Joyce passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows. Milking her cow is her hobby and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Joyce. 

Although this humble mom makes a living through selling milk, she faces the challenge of irrigating her farm and providing water to her animals. Nkubu is a remote area without piped water or electricity. Since Joyce is from a marginalized community, she is forced to walk long distances to search for water. She typically walks for two hours. Therefore, Joyce is requesting a loan to buy a water tank. Most of the rain water in her area goes to waste, and Joyce wants to harvest the water and store it in a water tank. 

The loan will save Joyce time and allow her to irrigate her farm during dry seasons and increase her productivity. The increase in productivity will translate into more income, which will provide Joyce with financial security. Joyce will also use the stored water for home consumption. Joyce's dream is to increase her farming activities and provide her children with a proper education. Education is the only way that her children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: to buy a water tank in order to harvest rain water for use.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 44-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are attending school. Jane sells secondhand clothes. She has been in that business for nineteen years. She also farms for additional income. Jane began her business to support her family. She is challenged by market competition, high transportation cost and high rental costs but finishing her commercial house is still her dream. Jane is asking for a loan to buy secondhand clothes such as dresses, skirts and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes such as dresses, skirts and others to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new model women's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Alice is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Alice has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming supplies, but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this coming season, Alice is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 5.75 acres will be planted by Alice's Group, and between them they will receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 2 hijos uno de 6 años y el otro de 3 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá, José tiene 28 años. 
José es un hombre que con mucho esfuerzo aprendió este oficio, donde  ahora genera sus ingresos económicos,  él ahora trabaja como piloto para una empresa en su comunidad, pues desde pequeño siempre anhelo ser piloto, pues para aprender esta actividad él tuvo que pagarle a otra persona para que le enseñara. 
José con este trabajo ha podido construir su casa, pero aún le hace falta  que equipar, pues pensando en sus hijos él y su esposa han pensado comprar un televisor para el entretenimiento de sus hijos y el beneficio de este aparato es para que los hijos tengan la manera de como distraerse  para ya nos  salir fuera de casa e ir con los vecinos. Por esta razón es que José esta buscando un prestamo de cinco mil quetzales y con el sueldo lo estaría abonando con los montos que establece su plan de pagos. El sueño de este señor es seguir equipando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
José is a father of two children, one who is 6 years old and another who is 3 years old. They live in a community in Sololá. José is 28 years old. 

José is a man who with much effort learned this profession, where he now earns his income. He currently works as a driver for a company in his community. From a young age he had always longed to be a driver, but in order to learn this activity he had to pay another person to teach him. 

José, with this job, has been able to build his house, but he still needs to furnish it. Thinking of their children, him and his wife have thought of buying a television for their entertainment.
