Judith started working with One Acre Fund in 2010, and to access quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve as she was able to consistently feed her family. This year she decided to represent her group to help more farmers.

Judith’s Group will receive farming supplies to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will purchase a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient seeds and fertilizer for the coming season.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a fifty-four-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of eleven farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Margaret has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Margaret described her harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus) last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of fourteen solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jacklyne's Group

texts.en:
Jacklyne represents a group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has 2 children. Her community believes her to be a very reliable person.

Jacklyne joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to earn enough money to feed her family. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she received training. Jacklyne will use the profits to send her children to school.

Between the 13 farmers in Jacklyne's Group, a total of 6.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will purchase a solar light. The group will receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre emprendedor, preocupado por el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia, de ´profesión Administrador escolar, desempeñándose como maestro de educación primaria con 19 años de laborar, casado, con 5 persona  a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por lo decidió  visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la    Compra de cemento, arena, piedrín, bloques y mano de obra, con los que realizaría la construcción de cuarto y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is an enterprising man, preoccupied with improving his family’s standard of living.  He is a school administrator by profession, and he has worked as a primary education teacher for 19 years.  He is married, with 5 people for whom he is responsible. 

He needs to make improvements to his home, so he decided to visit Ceprodel’s offices to request a loan.  He will use it to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and blocks; and to pay for labor in order to build a room. In this way, he would improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and blocks; and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Kifoyat

texts.ru:
Это женщина Кифоят. Она занимается шитьем «Курпа» и «курпача» уже более 2 лет. Она занимается у себя дома, по ее словам удобно сшить на дому. Ей в работе помогает невестка. «Курпу» используют в качестве одеяло а «курпача» длинные матрасы используется как диваны. 
Кифоят берет кредит, чтобы купить больше тканей, больше шить и соответственно больше получать доходы и продвинуть деятельность на новый уровень.
Кифоят замужем, и у нее один единственный сын. Он женат и ему 25 лет, невестке 26 лет.  Ее муж работает строительным мастером в районе. Ее цель кредит увеличить и расширить деятельность. В будущем Кифоят планирует приобрести много клиентов. Кифоят заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This woman is Kifoyat. She has been sewing "kurpa" (traditional bed covers) and "kurpacha" (traditional mattresses) for more than two years. She runs her business out of her home. According to her, it is comfortable to sew in her home. "Kurpa" are used as comforters and "kurpacha" are long mattresses used like sofas.

Kifoyat is taking out a loan to buy more fabric. This way she can sew more and correspondingly receive more income. This will allow her to advance her business to a new level.

Kifoyat is married and has one child - a son. He is married and is 25 years old. His wife is 26 years old. Kifoyat's husband works as a construction foreman in their district. Her goal is get a loan to improve and expand her business. Kifoyat plans to attract many customers in the future. Kifoyat thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy more fabric in order to continue her business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos para el hogar (lámparas, controles, radios, extensiones, toma corrientes, etc.), vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan, age 45, lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. He is in the business of selling assorted household items, such as lamps, remotes, radios, extension cords, and power outlets. He sells from a traveling stall and goes around the various neighborhoods near his home. Through his sales, he is able to get ahead. He is requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise at wholesale. This will let him keep working and earn greater income.

loans.use: buy a variety of household electrical goods at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various grocery items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals for preparing cooked food for resale

loans.name: Hada Esperanza

texts.es: Hada tiene 41 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hada, age 41, lives in her own home with her family. For ten years, she's run a small store located in part of her house. She has a lot of customers thanks to her good prices and her friendly nature. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more soup, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, cookies, and sweet breads. This will help her earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy soup, eggs, soft drinks, and more to stock her store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 40 años de edad se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca, age 40, has five years of experience in the business of making and selling tortillas. She runs her business out of her home and has many customers. She lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She is requesting this loan to buy corn in hundred-pound bags as well as lime. This will enable her to keep making tortillas, earn more income, and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy lime and large sacks of corn

loans.name: Malado's Group

texts.fr:
Créé depuis le 10 Décembre 2012, les femmes du Banc Villageois sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué. Elles ont comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Malado,(debout à l’extrême droite) la représentante une dame très engagée dans la gestion du groupement ainsi que de ses activités génératrices de revenu. Mariée et âgée de 31 ans elle est mère de quatre enfants, deux filles et deux garçons. Elle s’active dans le commerce de fruits qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre en ville

Avec son nouveau prêt elle désire acheter 10 sacs de fruits à 70000f pour les revendre à 100 000 f.

Les bénéfices lui permettent de d’augmenter son épargne et d’aider ses enfants dans leurs habillements et leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on December 10, 2012, and the women belonging to it are very united and, working together, have been able to develop solidarity and a commendable group spirit. Their principal activity is small-scale commerce.  

Madame Malado, standing on the extreme right, is the highlighted borrower, a woman who is very much engaged in managing the group as well as in her money-earning activities. Married and aged 31, she is the mother of four children, two daughters and two sons. She works at selling fruit which she buys in  the weekly markets to resell in Kolda. With her new loan she wants to buy 10 sacks of fruit for 70,000 francs to resell for 100,000 francs. 

The profits will allow her to grow her savings and help her children with clothing and school fees.

loans.use: 10 sacks of fruit at 70,000 francs

loans.name: Abelina De Jesus

texts.es: Abelina de 33 años de edad vive con su madre en casa propia, ella se dedica a vender huevos en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es muy vendible y lo da  a un precio muy accesible ella quiere acrecentar su negocio comprando huevos al por mayor por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo antes mencionado y así obtener mejores ganancias y poder tener junto con su madre una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Abelina is 33 years old and lives with her mother in her own house. She has sold eggs in the different colonies that are near her home for 5 years. With the earnings from her sales, she has succeeded in covering the household expenses. She has many clients, since her product is easy to sell and since she offers her products at an accessible price.

She wants to grow her business by buying eggs wholesale. For this, she requests a loan that will allow her to buy eggs wholesale. Thus, she will obtain better earnings and will be able have better financial stability with her mother.

loans.use: to buy eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Consuelo Idalma

texts.es: Consuelo de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 8 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia  y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Consuelo is 49 years old. She lives in her own house with her life companion. She has been selling clothing for 8 years. Her business is located in her house and she has many clients. She manages to pay some of the household expenses with what she earns. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale to be able to have higher income and a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Listening to Geoffrey referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one would mistake him for an Agricultural Extension Officer. Geoffrey, from Litein, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer in his locality. He has a wife and together they live on a small piece of land. 

Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops, a personal business, and he has been practicing farming for the past 13 years. Having done farming for such a long time he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. 

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Maasai tribe (Geoffrey’s tribe) - where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high and Geoffrey wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Geoffrey has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. 

Geoffrey always says that, “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert.  All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.” He has planted so many trees on his farm that food for the cattle will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge, because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. 

Through the loan, Geoffrey will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. Geoffrey has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, are there to make his dream come true. Geoffrey chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. 

Geoffrey underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season he learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits Geoffrey plans to permanently improve his living conditions, and to secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. He plans that through increased income, he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet's group consists of 11 farmers in the Kakamega North District. She is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. Violet has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is referred to as a very reliable person.

Violet isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she  joined the program in 2013 and has noticed that her life has changed. She has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, Violet will purchase fertilizer, seed, and a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study.

Violet's group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming supplies to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Danston's Group

texts.en:
Danston's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Danston, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 52 years old, is married and has 4 children. Danston has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Danston isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Danston will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Danston's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina is 68 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Regina has been with One Acre Fund for years and joined the program  in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.  She described her last harvest as very good but believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Regina also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Regina's group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Pamela will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Pamela plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Pamela’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds, a solar light and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old, lives in the town of the Mundri in South Sudan. She is responsible, and is very courteous in her correspondence with her customers in her work. 

She is requesting a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase fertilizer to increase the yield of her banana plantation, as well as to pay for workers in her fields.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to pay for the rent and labor of the land

loans.name: Jose Lucas

texts.es: Jose de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 12 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jose, age 42, lives in his own home with his wife and their three children. He owns a bodywork and painting shop located in his home and has been running it for 12 years. With what he earns from his work, he manages to make the household's ends meet. Jose is requesting this loan so that he can buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools to keep his business running. This will help him earn more money to give his family a better life with no limits.

loans.use: buy supplies and tools for his auto body shop

loans.name: Emmaculate's Group

texts.en:
Emmaculate is 22 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Miranga B village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Miranga B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from the communal water point . This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Emmaculate and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Emmaculate works as a business owner, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Emmaculate and 2 other promoters in her community, Paul and Milka, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Emmaculate will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Emmaculate wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser program will help reduce water-borne diseases by treating their water, thus improving the health of those in the community. She also says that when using chlorine children under 5 years old will be healthier.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Emmaculate’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Melisa's Group

texts.en:
Melisa is a 37-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Melisa has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Melisa described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Melisa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 2 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 61-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Margaret has noticed that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings.

Margaret described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Javier Roman

texts.es: Javier, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su esposa en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Macuelizo Santa Barbara. Javier lleva 4 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio que le genera ingresos para su familia, el realiza trabajos de reparación de electrodomésticos como son planchas, radios, equipos de sonido, televisores, micrófonos etc. esta actividad la realiza en su casa allí tiene instalado su taller. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo prestamo por 14,000 lempiras para poder comprar materiales e insumos como son estaño para soldadura, cable liso y dúo, tape y otros para la reparación de artículos electrodomésticos que tiene pendientes. Su plan es  contratar otra persona para ampliar el negocio  y obtener más utilidades.
texts.en: Javier, 39, is married and lives with his wife in a village that belongs to the municipality of Macuelizo Santa Barbara. Javier has been working at his own business for 4 years making income for his family. He does repair work on household appliances such as irons, radios, sound systems, televisions, microphones, etc. He does this in his house where he has his workshop. He has decided to ask for a second loan of 14,000 lempiras [$675] in order to buy materials and goods such as tin for soldering, straight and duo cables, tape and other items for repairing household appliances that he has awaiting repair. His plan is to contract another person to expand the business and make more earnings.

loans.use: to buy tin for soldering, tape and straight and duo cables to repair household appliances

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Otigo village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Otigo village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Konyango spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Margaret and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Margaret works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Margaret and another promoter in her community, Susan, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Margaret will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Margaret wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will help to prevent water-borne diseases. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Margaret’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: Toprovide her community with access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old, and a single mother from Mundri, South Sudan. She has had to work for most of her young life, and has been farming tea for the past years of her life. 

She is requesting a loan of 900 SSP to purchase farming tools to increase her crops yield. She hopes to make her business more successful.

loans.use: To purchase farming tools

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: José es un hombre de 55 años de edad que desde joven aprendió los oficios del campo y actualmente se gana la vida con la compra y venta de ganado bovino actividad que realiza desde hace más de 20 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran experiencia que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos, para salir adelante al lado de su familia, por lo que se siente feliz. José vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 18 años de edad que son su mayor orgullo y la razón de su esfuerzo.  En el negocio de compra venta de ganado bovino José es muy experto lo que le permite saber cuáles son las mejores compras y ventas, es por ello que desea invertir en más ganado para seguir sacando adelante a su familia y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en ganado bovino y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José is a 55-year-old man who learned farming when he was very young, and today he earns a living buying and selling cattle.  He has been engaged in this occupation for more than 20 years, so he has a lot of experience.  This allows him to obtain better earnings in order to get ahead, along with his family—something that makes him feel happy. José lives with his wife and their three children, ages 12, 10, and 18, who are his greatest pride and the reason that he strives. 

José is very expert in the business of buying and selling cattle, which allows him to know which buys and sales are best.  That is why he wants to invest in more cattle, in order to continue to provide for his family and give them the best living conditions.  That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cattle, and thus improve his earnings.

loans.use: to invest in cattle to sell and to provide for his family.

loans.name: Imelda De La Paz

texts.es: Imelda de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos (tostaditas de plátanos, papas y yuca), vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y pintándolas, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por eso solicita nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez es para la compra de cemento, arena, pintura y pago de mano de obra y así poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Imelda, age 32, lives in her own home with her husband and their four children. She is in the business of selling snacks such as chips made from plantain, potato, and yucca. She sells from a traveling stall through the various neighborhoods around her house. She wants to improve her home by plastering the walls and painting them.  However, what she earns isn't able to cover the cost. That's why she is asking for this new loan, which she will use to buy cement, sand, paint, and to pay for manual labor. That way, she can improve her home.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, and paint and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es: Zoila de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Zoila is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has owned a small shop for several years located in her place of residence, where she sells a variety of products such as candy, soda, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc. and she has many customers because of her good prices. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale stock because that is her only source of income and in this way she will be able to improve her earnings to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products including sweets, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies and sugar wholesale

loans.name: Albai Del Carmen

texts.es: Albai vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Albai está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Albai lives in her own home with her husband. She has made a living for the past 10 years selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. Albai is requesting a loan to purchase quintals of corn and lime to be able to continue making tortillas so she can have better income and a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase quintals of corn and lime powder

loans.name: Carmen Lilian

texts.es: Carmen de 52 años de edad es viuda vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de mariscos y pescados su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para compra de mas pescados y mariscos por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carmen is a 52-year-old widow who lives in her own home with her daughter. She has made a living for the past 6 years selling seafood. Her business is located in the municipal market and she has many customers because of her good prices. With the sales she makes she can afford to pay some of her household costs. She is requesting a loan to buy more seafood wholesale to continue her sales and in this way improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more seafood wholesale

loans.name: Chozvo Group 9

texts.en:
Chozvo 9 are a proud group of 14 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sells its crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. The group in total farms 14.5 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer. 

Access to a group loan of 26,060 Meticais (776 USD) equates to an average of 1,861 Meticais (55 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they need. Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yields

loans.name: Walter's Group

texts.en:
Walter is 35 years old, has 5 children, and lives in Kakseru B village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Kakseru B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from the local well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Walter and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Walter works as a subsistence/peasant farmer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Walter and another promoter in his community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Walter will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Walter wants to be a promoter because he believes that the chlorine prevents water-borne diseases, resulting in fewer children missing school, more people at work, and improved health overall.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Walter’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide his community with free access to a water-treating system

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre muy responsable con su familia  y en su comunidad, él tiene 25 años tiene una hermosa hija de aproximadamente 2 años, dicha familia vive en una comunidad de Solol. 
 
Daniel es una persona muy visionaria y todo en beneficio de su familia, él trabaja en la alcaldía de su  comunidad, él puesto que tiene Daniel es dibujante, él es el encargado de hacer algunos planos de los proyectos  que trabaja la alcaldía, con este trabajo lleva dos años, Daniel aparte de este trabajo el también compra y vende productos elaborados con mostacilla, de esta manera Daniel genera sus ingresos económicos, para cubrir todo lo necesario para el bienestar de su familia. 

Daniel como todo padre de familia se preocupa por su familia, para darles todo lo mejor, pues la meta de él ahora es darle acabado a su casa, por lo que necesita comprar materiales y pagar mano de obra, pues para realizar este trabajo Daniel está solicitando un prestamo de  cinco mil quetzales el anhelo de  este señor es empezar con los trabajos y sus aspiraciones  es poder seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda poco a poco y darles también estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Daniel is a very responsible man with his family and in his community. He is 25 years old and has a 2 year old daughter and they live in a community in Solola. Daniel is a very visionary person all for the good of his family.

He works in the municipal hall of his community where he works as a draftsman. He is in charge of making plans for the projects that the municipality is working on. He has been doing this for 2 years. Daniel besides this, works buying and selling beaded products .Doing this Daniel generates economic income to pay for what is needed for the well-being of his family.

Daniel as every father of a family is worried about his family and wants to give them the best of everything. His goal is to complete his house so he needs to buy materials and pay foe labor to do this. . So to undertake this work Daniel is requesting a loan of 5,000 GTQ. His wish is to start the work and his dream is to little by little continue to make improvements on his house and also provide his child with her education.

loans.use: to buy material to finish construction.

loans.name: Chozvo Group 8

texts.en:
Chozvo 6 are a proud group of 15 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sells its crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. The group in total farms 11.5 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer. 

Access to a group loan of 28,250 Meticais (841 USD) equates to an average of 1,883 Meticais (56 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they need. Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yield

loans.name: Charles Wambura's Group

texts.en:
Charles is 75 years old, has 6 children, and lives in Keburui village in Kenya. Charles works as a subsistence farmer for a living. The community of Keburui village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases like cholera and typhoid. Charles is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected promoter by his village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer promoter, Charles represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Charles and 3 other promoters in the community - Marwa, Tabitha and Martha - need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Charles wants to be a promoter because he believes that chlorine makes the water safe for everyone to drink.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Charles’ community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.use: To provide her community with water-treating chlorine dispensers

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John lives in a home with mud walls, dirt floor and iron roof in Kuberetu B village in Kuria East Sub-county, Kenya with his family which includes 8 children. The community of Kuberetu B village collects their drinking water from a local well because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kuberetu B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser program offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. Kuberetu B community will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. John has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their drinking water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 4 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Penina, Mwita, Seline and Eunice.

Kuberetu B community needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. John believes that chlorine kills bacteria in water making it safe to drink, thus improving health for children and adults in his community. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that John’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that his community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Allan Alberto

texts.es:
Allan es un joven honesto, trabajador, amable y con muchas ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de él y de su familia.  Siempre ha tenido presente la importancia de acceder a la educación. A pesar de las dificultades económicas, ha sabido ingeniárselas para superarse profesionalmente, ya sea en su trabajo provisional de supervisor de obras o ayudando a su papa en el taller de soldadura que este tiene. 

Él es egresado de Ingeniería en Alimentos, y ahora quiere continuar fortaleciendo sus conocimientos con una maestría en  procesamientos de alimentos, por eso, solicita el financiamiento para estudiar la maestria, pues no cuenta con el capital necesario para pagar los aranceles. Allan espera, a corto plazo, obtener un mejor puesto en el campo laboral que más lo apasiona.
texts.en:
Allan is an honest, hard working, kind young man with a great desire to improve the quality of his life and that of his family.  He has always kept in mind the importance of access to education.  In spite of economic difficulties, he has known how to manage it in order to excel professionally, whether in his provisional job as works supervisor or helping his father in his welding workshop. 

He is a graduate of Food Engineering and now he wants to continue strengthening his knowledge with a master's in Food Processing.  Thus, he is asking for the financing in order to study for his master's degree since he doesn't have the necessary capital to pay the tuition.  Allan hopes, in the short term, to obtain a better position in the labour field that he is most passionate about.

loans.use: to have the financing to study for his master's degree

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo  es reconocido en su comunidad por ser una persona muy generosa y amable, él tiene 36 años, vive junto a su familia  en una comunidad de Sololá,  tiene 3 hijos  entre las edades de 7 y 11 años.

Domingo para la generación de sus ingresos económicos, él trabaja como albañil en su comunidad, él construye casas, muros y otras cosas relacionadas con la albañilería. Este trabajo lo viene desempeñando desde hace 10 años, con este trabajo Domingo saca avante a su familia ya que él no cuenta con ningún otro ingreso.
 
Domingo ama y quiere mucho  a su familia, pues con él amor que tiene a su familia, el necesita de avanzar algunos planes que se ha propuesto en beneficio de ellos,  pues uno de los trabajos que él quiere realizar es empezar con el acabado de su construcción  para darles una mejor comodidad a su familia.  Domingo para poder ejecutar estos trabajos necesita de un prestamo  de dos mil quetzales y con este monteo él empezara  darle acabado a su casa conforme va pudiendo.
El propósito de Domingo es terminar su casa y seguramente lo lograra ya que él es un hombre muy perseverante y responsable.
texts.en:
Domingo is recognized in his community for being a very generous and kind person. He is 36 years old, and he lives with his family in a community in Sololá.  He has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 11. 

In order to generate income, Domingo works as a bricklayer in his community; he builds houses, walls, and other things related to bricklaying. He has been doing this work for 10 years, and this is how he supports his family, as he has no other source of income. 

Domingo loves his family very much, and he needs to move forward with some of his plans to benefit them. One of the plans that he wants to carry out is to start the finish work on his construction, in order to make his family more comfortable. 

In order to carry out this work, Domingo needs a loan of two thousand Quetzals, an amount that would enable him to finish his house.  Domingo’s goal is to finish his house; and he will surely accomplish this, as he is a very persevering and responsible man.

loans.use: to finish construction.

loans.name: Maria Evelia

texts.es: Maria de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 67 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her daughter.  She has worked for 20 years making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal (hundredweight) and lime in order to be able to continue making tortillas and thus be able to have improved earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal (hundredweight) and lime

loans.name: Ricardo Arturo

texts.es: Ricardo de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de pescados vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa ya  tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para compra de mas pescados por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ricardo is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He has made a living for the past 6 years selling fish. He is a street vendor and sells in the different markets near his home. He has many customers because his prices are good. With the sales he makes he can pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more fish wholesale to continue working and in this way improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase fish wholesale

loans.name: Ana Tiburcia

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando ya está su cosecha la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografía para comercializarlos en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She has made a living for 15 years from agriculture, growing corn and beans. When the harvest is ready she stores it in sacks, as seen in the photograph, and sells them in the surrounding towns. She has many regular clients. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. to continue growing her crops because that is her only source of work and she wants to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  posee un taller de estructuras metálicas donde elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man with the blurred face is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He has a metalsmithing shop where he makes doors, balconies, iron bars and other items. He has had this business for 10 years. He has many customers who seek him out for the quality of his work, accessible prices, but above all because he always works to please the customer. The young man lives in his own home with his wife. He seeks a loan from INTEGRAL that will enable him to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. and in this way he can have better income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Marcos Cruz

texts.es: Marcos de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijo, el posee un taller automotriz desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto para bodega y colocando el techo y piso en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no tiene de suficiente capital para realizarlo solicita nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez es para poder comprar laminas, ladrillos, cemento, arena, cerámica, polines y pago de mano de obra para poder tener un mejor lugar para trabajar.
texts.en: Marcos is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has had a car repair shop for several years, with which he works to be able to meet some household expenses. He wants to make home improvements by building a room for a store and adding a roof and floor in the place demonstrated in the photo but he doesn't have enough capital to build. He seeks a new loan but this time it is to buy sheet metal, bricks, cement, sand, ceramic tile, structural beams, and pay for labor in order to be able to have a better place to work.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, bricks, cement, sand, ceramic tile, structural beams, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Adonaldo

texts.es: Adonaldo de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la albañilería desde hace varios años con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos y hierro para que el y su familia puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en: Adonaldo is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has been a bricklayer for several years and with the income he is able to meet some household expenses. He wants to improve his home, building a perimeter wall at the site located in the photograph but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore he seeks a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron so that he and his family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza de ganado de engorde y al cultivo de granos básicos, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasión lo solicita para la compra de mas ganando para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face is pixelated because he is 25 year old and lives in a high risk zone, has for five years been making a living raising cattle for fattening and cultivating basic grains.  He sells his products in the different markets that are found near his house.  With what he makes from his sales, he is able to forge ahead.  The young man lives in his own house with his wife and son.
He is once again requesting a loan, but this time he is asking for it to buy more cattle in order to continue with his work since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es: Pedro de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 6 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus siembras y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 39 years old and lives with his parents in a house that they own.  He works growing corn and sorghum, which he has done for the past six years.  He sells his produce in different markets near his home.  With his sales, he is able to cover his household expenses. 

Pedro is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure and pesticides, as well as to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph.  This will allow him to continue with his farming and improve his earnings.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure and pesticides, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Richard Stalyn

texts.es: Richard es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus hermanos en una casa que les presta el municipio junto a los tanques de agua, ya que Richard y su familia son los cuidadores y encargados del mantenimiento de los tanques de agua que reparte a la ciudad, Richard se dedica a la crianza de chanchos,   pollos y demás animales menores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y de ahí espera comprar más de estos animales para  mejorar su negocio   y  aumentar sus ingresos, la aspiración de Richard es seguir trabajando en su negocio y junto a su familia le gustaría comprar una casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de todos ellos.
texts.en:
Richard is a 20 year-old youth who lives with his mother and his siblings in a house that is loaned to them by the municipality.  It is located next to water tanks, because Richard and his family are the caretakers who are in charge of maintaining the water tanks that dispense water to the city.  

Richard has a business raising pigs, chickens, and other small animals.  He will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs, and from there he hopes to buy more of these animals to improve his business and increase his income.

Richard aspires to continue to work in his business and with his family.  He would like to buy a home to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
In Kwihemba B village in Kuria east sub-county, Kenya, Joyce has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Joyce is a friendly member of the community with 5 children. Joyce lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor and iron roof.

Kwihemba B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a local water spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Joyce’s community need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Joyce has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Joyce volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community to understand that chlorine kills germs in the water making it safe to drink, thus preventing sickness and improving life. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Bakari, James, Moses, and Catherine.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joyce’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide her community with free access to chlorine to treat drinking water

loans.name: Silvia's Group

texts.en:
In Kogaja village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Silvia has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Silvia is a friendly member of the community with 2 children. Silvia lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Kogaja village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Care borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Silvia’s family and the 50 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Silvia has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Silvia volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community by providing access to safe water, thus reducing water-borne diseases. There are also three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Victor, Charles, and Moses.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Silvia’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide her community with free access to chlorine to treat drinking water

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un señor casado de 36 años, él tiene una hermosa  familia de 3 hijos, ellos estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Concepción. 

Pablo es un hombre que se dedica  duro al trabajado  cada día, para generar su economía, la actividad que realiza Pablo es la compra y venta de verduras, eligió esta actividad ya que en el lugar donde vive, es una zona totalmente agrícola y en toda la época del año se consigue verdura, de esta manera pablo ha logrado alcanzar sus metas y objetivos  con su familia. 
Pues Pablo para seguir con esta actividad necesita contar con suficiente  capital de trabajo,  y es por eso que él solicita un prestamo que le servirá para comprar cebollas por cuerda, esta actividad es  muy  ventajoso por que se compra ya la verdura solo para cosechar  o sea no se hace todo el trabajo que lleva. Pues para lograr hacer la  compra es necesario contar con suficiente dinero porque los agricultores lo venden a precios elevados. 
El sueño de pablo es generar más ingresos y ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos y  que más adelante también piensa construirles una casa mejor de la que tiene ahora.
texts.en:
Pablo is a married 36  year-old man.  He has a beautiful family including 3 children who study in the local school.  This family lives in the community of Concepcion.

Pablo is a man who works hard every day to generate his income.  He has a business buying and selling vegetables.  He chose this activity because the place where is lives is entirely agricultural, and produces vegetables throughout the year.  With this business, he has been able to achieve his goals and objectives for his family.  

Now, Pablo wants to continue with this business, and he needs to have sufficient working capital.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy onions by the cuerda (a cuerda is 28 square meters of land).  This activity is very advantageous, because he buys the vegetables only at the harvest; he doesn't have to do the work to grow them. But to be able to make this purchase he needs to have enough money, because the farmers sell their crops at high prices.  

Pablo's dream is to generate more income and earnings so that he can continue to invest in his children's education.  Also, in the future, he plans to build them a house that is better than the one they have now.

loans.use: to buy onions in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, tiene un negocio de venta de tejas, ladrillos, lavaderos de cemento entre otras cosas, tiene muchos clientes  por los buenos precios y localidad de sus productos, el joven vive en casa propia con sus padres y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, pintura, arena y aceite para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been pixelated is 27 years old and lives in a very dangerous area.  He has a business selling tiles, bricks, cement sinks and other items.  He has many customers because of his fair prices and the location of his products.  He lives in his parents' home.

He is seeking a loan to purchase cement, paint, sand and oil so that he can continue working and improve his income.

loans.use: purchase cement, paint, sand and oil.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, Bertila está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Bertila is 36 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in a house that they own.  For the past 10 years she has worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  She sells her produce throughout the region that she lives in and she has many customers.

Bertila is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc., to improve her land, which can be seen in the photograph so that she can continue with her work and improve her income.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc to improve his land.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa se destaca en su comunidad y en algunos lugares aledaños por ser una persona amable y solidaria. Ella tiene 52 años, tiene una familia de 7  hijos comprendida entre las edades de 11 a 34 años.  Todos viven en una comunidad de María Tecún de Sololá. 

Josefa es una mujer que no sabe leer ni escribir, pero eso no ha sido obstáculo para superarse en la vida y con sus hijos, ella con el aprendizaje de sus padres, genera sus ingresos económicos a través de la agricultura, ella cultiva papa y entre otras hortalizas, con sus ingresos ella complementa los gastos de su canasta básica y cubre otros gastos siempre al beneficio de sus hijos. Pues con el afán de seguir con la agricultura ella solicita un prestamo que le servirá para compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su cultivo, Josefa es una mujer muy visionaria porque todo lo que emprende lo alcanza con mucho éxito. 
El anhelo de Josefa es que con las ganancias ella piensa terminar de construir su casita en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is known in her community and some places nearby as a friendly and solidary person.  She is 52 years old and has a family of seven children between the ages of 11 and 34.  They all live in the community of Maria Tecun of Sololá.
Josefa is a woman who doesn't know how to read or write, but this has not been an obstacle to overcome in life and she with her children and what she learned from her parents generates her economic income through agriculture.  She cultivates potatoes and other vegetables.  With her income, she covers the household expenses and other expenses always for the benefit of her children.  With the desire the continue with her agriculture, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crop.  Josefa in a very visionary woman because, everything she undertakes, she achieves with much success.
Josefa's wish is that with the earnings she is thinking of completing the construction of her house for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eufronia

texts.en:
Eufronia makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Lawa-an, Aloran in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. She has been able to provide for her family by doing this type of work. 

Now, Eufronia wishes to plant banana seedlings of a good variety on her coconut farm to add to the farm's yield. However, she is in need of working capital. 

Eufronia presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to prepare the farm's soil and plant the banana seedlings. 

Eufronia has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to prepare her farm's soil and plant banana seedlings.

loans.name: Norelis Isabel

texts.es: Norelis es una emprendedora mujer que trabajo durante varios años en almacenes que comercializaban diferentes tipos de productos, gracias a estas experiencias laborales tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio un almacén misceláneo en el que ofrece productos de belleza, cosméticos, bisutería, papelería, juguetería, servicio de minutos a celular, recargas y golosinas.  Este negocio tiene cinco años de funcionamiento en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, el horario de atención es de 7:30 a.m. a 9:30 p.m. todos los días, sus ventas en su gran mayoría se generan de contado sin embargo ella también ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes; vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes del centro de la ciudad a distribuidores y mayoristas, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la copra de ropa para niños, blusas, pantalones y ropa interior. Norelis tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos de 19 y 11 años y de dos hijas cada una de 9 años a quienes desea continuarles brindando bienestar, su meta a largo plazo es ampliar su negocio y tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
Norelis is an enterprising woman who has worked for several years in stores that sold different kinds of products. Thanks to these work experiences she made the decision to start her own general store offering a variety of products including beauty, cosmetics, office supply, costume jewelry, toys, cell phone minutes, recharging phone cards, and candy. She has had this business for 5 years in the Barranquilla neighborhood. It is open from 7:30 AM until 9:30 PM every day. Her sales are generally cash transaction but she also offers payments to her customers, who include neighbors, friends, and acquaintances. She makes her purchases from stores and wholesale distributors in the city center. She is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which will enable her to invest in the purchase of clothing for children as well as blouses, pants and undergarments.

Norelis is 37 years old and mother of two sons ages 19 and 11 and two daughters who are 9 years old. Norelis wishes to continue providing for their well-being. Her long term goal is to expand her business and have her own commercial locale.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing for children as well as blouses, pants and undergarments.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
José, se mantiene mejorando su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos y  crianza de ganado con la uso de créditos, su nueva situación financiera le permite cubrir los gastos familiares e iniciar la crianza de cerdos.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar cerdos, una vaca y pagara los costos de la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, de esa manera aumentara la productividad de su negocio, con esta nueva inversión espera mantener su negocio en con vida y que sus animales estén saludables.
texts.en:
José continues to improve his basic grain farming and livestock business through loans.  His current financial situation allows him to cover his household expenses as well as begin to raise pigs.

He is seeking a loan to purchase pigs, a cow and to pay to harvest his crops.  This way, he will increase the productivity of his business.  With the new investment, he hopes to keep his business alive and his animals healthy.

loans.use: purchase pigs, a cow, and pay to harvest his basic grain crops.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, la joven vive con su madre en casa propia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc.  y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 25 years old and lives in a zone of high risk, raises corn and beans. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the silos that are shown in the photograph to later sell in the various markets that are close to her house. The young woman lives with her mother in their own house. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc., to thus be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Guadalupe

texts.es: Esperanza es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y su hijo es de 9 años de edad y si esta estudiando, ella se dedica a trabajar de vendedora en una tercena y también tiene su negocio que es la crianza de animales menores, Esperanza vive con sus padres y su hijo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en chancheras que le hace tener su madre o en un espacio verde,  la aspiración de esta madre amorosa es que mejoren sus ingresos y  que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a single mother.  She is 32 years old and has a 9 year old son who is in school.  She works as a saleswoman in a butcher shop, and she also has a business raising small animals.  Esperanza lives with his parents and her son.

She will use this loan to purchase hogs that she will either keep in a pigpen that her mother has or in a pasture.  This loving mother's dream is to improve her income and for her son to finish his studies.

loans.use: purchase hogs.

loans.name: Nyame Akwan Ye Group

texts.en:
Frederick, a 53-year-old man, comes from Mbem in the Twifo Hemang Lower Denkyira District in the Central Region of Ghana. He is a cocoa farmer. He is married with six children. The children's ages are 2, 4, 6, 9, 15, and 19 years. All six children are attending school. With 14 years' experience in farming, he has been able to manage 16 acres of cocoa farm. Frederick is optimistic that he can add five acres more to the old farm in the year ahead. He processes palm oil for consumption for sale on a commercial basis. 

Frederick participated in community education on reducing deforestation, climate change and clean cooking. He was convinced by the demonstration and took the decision to buy an Elsa Clean Cook stove. He then complained of the huge cost the family incurred during cooking based on the use of charcoal and the several miles they trek before getting firewood to supplement their cooking on an open wire three stone cook stove. 

Frederick is now happy that changes to the Elsa Clean Cook stove will help solve the cooking problems for the family since the fuel (palm kennel shells) is a by-product of his oil processing. He needs micro loan assistance to purchase an Elsa clean cook stove to improve the health of the family and reduce their household energy expenditure. Frederick thanks all his micro lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José, se dedica a desarrollar actividades agropecuarias tales como crianza de ganado y siembra de granos básicos, vive son su pareja y un hijo, José es el que tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades familiares, tiene 5 años trabajando de manera independiente, por lo general trabaja solo, cuando es necesario contrata mozos para que le ayuden, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., a desempeñar estas actividades le enseño su padre.
Será de utilidad el crédito para comprar una vaquilla, aumentara el ganado, espera que en un futuro le produzca mejores ganancias para cubrir todos sus compromisos puntualmente. El riesgo son las enfermedades en los animales.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio con bases estables para tener mejores condiciones económicas para todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
José works in carrying out agricultural activities such as raising livestock and planting basic grains. He lives with his partner and a son. José is the one who has the responsibility for covering the family necessities. He has worked independently for five years. In general, he works alone. When it is necessary, he hires farmhands so that they can help him. His schedule is from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm. His father taught him to perform these tasks. 

The loan will be useful for buying a heifer and increasing his livestock. He hopes that in the future it will produce better earnings for him, to cover all his obligations on time. The risks are sicknesses in the animals.

His goals are to have a business with a stable foundation in order to have better economic conditions for all his immediate family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to increase his livestock. He hopes that in the future it will produce better earnings to cover all his obligations.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de plátanos, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes, el joven vive en casa propia con compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas plátano por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 28 years old and lives in a zone of high risk, has worked for a number of years selling bananas. His business is located near his house in a zone with a lot of traffic, and he has many customers. The young man lives in his own house with his life companion.
