He is applying for a loan to purchase more bananas wholesale in order to be able to continue with his sales and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy more bananas wholesale

loans.name: Francisco  Efigenio

texts.es: Francisco de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijo, el se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de caña de azúcar comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con el cultivo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Francisco, who is 53 years old, lives in his own home with his two children. He has raised sugar cane for 10 years. He sells his products in the areas surrounding his zone and he already has many customers. With what he obtains from his sales, he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc., to be able to continue with his farming and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, se encuentra sin capital suficiente y por ello solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar repuestos para refrigeradoras, cocinas, aires acondicionados y otros electrodoméstico, así tendrá oportunidad mejorar el servicio a sus clientes y tener los ingresos que tanto necesita para salir adelante.
El crédito anterior ha sido muy útil para que su negocio tenga mejor competitividad en el mercado, las nuevas ganancias han servido para comprar herramientas para realizar mejor su trabajo y seguir aportando para que su familia tenga una vida más digna.
texts.en:
José finds himself without sufficient capital, and for this reason, he is applying for a new loan to buy spare parts for refrigerators, stoves, air conditioners, and other domestic appliances. Thus he will have the opportunity to improve the service to his customers and to have the income that he so much needs in order to get ahead. 

The past loan has been very useful so that his business could be more competitive in the market. The new earnings have served him to buy tools to do his work better and continue supporting his family so that they can have a more dignified life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for refrigerators, stoves, air conditioners, and other domestic appliances.

loans.name: Johel Antonio

texts.es: Johel de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 25 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Johel, who is 40 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked in agriculture for 25 years. He plants corn, beans, and sorghum. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the graneries that are shown in the photograph to later sell it in the various markets that are near his house. He is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc., in order to be able to continue with his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 30 años a la crianza y venta de cerdos, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas cerdos por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She has been working for the past 30 years raising and selling hogs.  She sells her animals in areas near where she lives and she has lots of customers.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more hogs in bulk in order to be able to continue with her work and thus have better income.

loans.use: to purchase hogs in bulk

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de panes con pollos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto y encementando el piso, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no logra realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de  cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Sonia is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She works selling breads and chicken.  With her sales she is able to pay for her household expenses.  She wants to improve her home by building a room and creating a concrete floor, but with what she earns from her sales she is not able to do it.  For this reason she is asking for a loan in order to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron and labor so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron and labor to create a cement floor and add a bedroom to her home.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah faces considerable preparation for the post-harvest operations of her banana farm in Punta Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time and money for the packaging, storage, and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her loan proposal to Paglaum MPC. 

Sarah hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay post-harvest expenses of banana farm, including packaging, storage, and processing of harvest

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, está viviendo actualmente con su compañera de vida y un hijo los cuales son totalmente dependientes de don él, la agricultura es su medio de sustento, además comercializa cerdos para mejorar sus ingresos, por su experiencia no representa dificultades.
Invertirá en cerdos y granos básicos de los cuales no cultiva para tener mejores ingresos, cuidara de los cerdos para luego venderlos con facilidad a sus clientes, espera mejorar la situación financiera para ir progresando junto con su familia.
Sus objetivos son ir ampliado su negocio para cancelar su deuda y ofrecer un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
José is living currently with his life partner and his son who are completely dependent on him.  He sustains his family through agriculture, as well as by raising and selling pigs in order to increase his income.  Because he has lots of experience he has not had difficulties.  He will invest in pigs and basic grains that he does not yet cultivate in order to increase his income.  He will care for the hogs in order to later sell them to his customers.  He hopes to improve his economic situation and to continue moving forward along with his family.

His goals are to grow his business in order to repay his debt and to offer a better future to his family.

loans.use: to invest in pigs and basic grains that he does not yet cultivate in order to increase his income.  He will care for the hogs in order to later sell them to his customers.

loans.name: Jeanth Faith

texts.en:
Jeanth Faith lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao, Philippines. She is married and has two children. She sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell. Jeanth Faith has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies and to finish her studies even though she is married already.

loans.use: to buy bananas to resell

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. Joy has a farming business. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Joy received another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help to give her farming income a big boost. Joy looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for compost and seedlings

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 31 years old and lives in Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and has two children. Jonalyn has a firewood business and earns approximately 500 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to buy inventory for her business. Jonalyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jonalyn hopes to venture into another business.

loans.use: to buy additional trees for firewood

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene is a businesswoman from Landing, Balianagao. She is 44 years old, single, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store (variety store) and earns a meager income that is adequate enough to support her family. Marlene is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Marlene continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to successfully face all the challenges with courage for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities for her store

loans.name: Maura Esthela

texts.es: Maura es madre soltera, esta cruzando sus 29 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 9 y 12 años de edad y todos están estudiando, Maura se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y al trabajo del jornal, son 5 años que Maura se dedica  a la crianza de pollos y le va bien en este negocio, por este motivo Maura solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos pequeños y en el momento que crezcan poder venderlos obteniendo alguna ganancia, para de este modo seguir trabajando y que sus hijos tengan lo necesario.
texts.en: Maura is a single mother who is about to turn 29 years old and who has three children, ages 6, 9, and 12.  All of them are in school.  Maura works raising small animals and also works as a day laborer.  She has been raising animals for the past five years and things are going well in her business.  For this reason she is requesting a loan in order to purchase small chickens (chicks) so that once they are grown she can resell them and obtain an income.  In this way she will continue working so that her children will have what they need.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Nyame Ne Ye Boafo Group

texts.en: Abigail is 43 years old and lives in Mbem in the Twifo Hemang Lower Denkyira District in the Central Region of Ghana. She is a married woman with six children. The ages of her children are 6, 10, 15, 19, 22, and 24 years old. Her six children are all attending school. Farming is the main occupation for Abigail. She has a 10-acre palm oil plantation and an 8-acre cocoa farm. With 10 years of farming experience, which she is proud of, she also has a provision store as another source of income. Abigail uses the palm fruit as raw material for her palm oil extraction business. She has five employees supporting her. Abigail participated in the community education on reducing deforestation and clean cooking. She has the fuel, palm kennel shells, as waste material from her oil processing. Abigail wants to acquire an Elsa Clean Cook Stove, since it is difficult getting firewood for cooking. Besides, it will help save the forest in her village. She thanks all her micro lenders for helping her to save time looking for firewood and help save the trees of the forest in her village.

loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 36 years old. She has a bag making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for nine years.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and is married with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gemma has been farming sugarcane for two years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending and raising pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maytachelle

texts.en:
Maytachelle is 35 years old and is married with two children. With two children currently in school, Maytachelle works very hard to provide for them.

Maytachelle runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, coffee, and cereals to sell.

In the future, Maytachelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, coffee, and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 50 years old. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Martina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Martina requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Martina has been raising livestock for 35 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Martina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Jilma

texts.en:
Jilma is 39 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Jilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jilma has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Denny

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of our agents, Denny. Denny lives in Cibanteng, Bogor, West Java. He lives there with his wife and his two children. He just joined Ruma for a month. Denny feels happy he joined Ruma because he thinks that Ruma keeps improving the services every day and he can learn about managing his business on his own.

Denny and his wife are really persistent and hardworking people. Denny owns a stall selling mobile airtime credits and small snacks. His wife helps him to get more income by being an insurance agent and selling women's fashion like clothes and accessories. Both of their children go to school. As the business runs, he needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime credits. Your loan will help him very much to improve his business. As seen in the photo, Denny is sitting in front of his stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Hermenegildo ha logrado alcanzar sus objetivos  por ser una persona disciplinada, él tiene 42 años de edad, tiene una bonita familia de 3 hijos, ellos estudian en una escuelita de su comunidad, esta familia vive en Calzada Venancio Barrios en Sololá. 
Hermenegildo para generar sus ingresos económicos él tiene actualmente una tienda de abarrotes y dentro de la tienda también tiene servicio de internet, es una actividad reciente, pero por la generosidad en que atiende su negocio si tiene demanda, pues para que pueda satisfacer a toda la clientela, él necesita comprar más equipos de cómputo tales como Impresora, memorias USB y computadoras, pues equipar su negocio él se ha puesto a la tarea de buscar un prestamo para poder comprar todo este equipo . 
Pues Hermenegildo tiene la certeza de que su negocio le va funcionar, porque una de las esperanzas es que existen muchos estudiantes que día tras día buscan este servicio, lo que necesita para equipar su negocio son tres mil quinientos quetzales, y con las ganancias él pagara el prestamo.   
El sueño de Hermenegildo es ampliar su negocio hasta tener un local más  grande y adecuado para darle una mejor atención a las personas que lo visitan.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo has achieved his goals by being a disciplined person. He is 42 years old and has a nice family with 3 children. They study at a school in their community. The family lives in Calzada Venancio Barrios in Solola.

To generate income Hermenegildo currently has a grocery store and in the store he also offers internet service. This is a recent activity, but because of his generosity in attending the business, there is demand for it. In order to satisfy all of his customers, he needs to buy more computer equipment such as a printer, USB drives and computer to fit out his business. He has set himself the task of requesting a loan to buy all of this equipment.

Hermenegildo is confident that his business will work out for him because he expects that there are many students who will use this service daily. In order to buy this equipment he needs three thousand five hundred quetzales. He will pay off the loan with the profits.

Hermenegildo's dream is to expand his business to have a larger and more suitable shop in order to better serve the people who visit it.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment

loans.name: Carquina

texts.en:
Carquina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carquina is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Carquina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Carquina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 37 years old and single with two children who are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Connie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like coffee, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for four years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like coffee, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Uranchimeg, 51 years old, lives with her son and daughter in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has been working as a chemist at a power plant for 30 years. Her son works as a welder while her daughter works at a filling station. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy an electric car for personal use. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants into the air and wastes less fuel. She needs this environmentally friendly car in order to go between her home and work due to her declining health.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino es un padre de familia de 6 hijos, él tiene 35 años de edad, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá, 
Paulino es un hombre que desde pequeño aprendió esta actividad,  él se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas tales como papa, zanahoria y entre otros productos, la mayor parte de la producción los vende en el mercado de su comunidad y otro parte los clientes lo llegan a comprar hasta donde él cosecha. Paulino para logra más  ingresos y ganancias  en su cultivo  en la época de siembre y cosecha involucra a sus hijos para que lo apoyen y de esa manera se evita pagar jornales  a otras personas.
 Paulino no tiene otro ingreso, pues él está contento con su trabajo ya que  con los ingresos de la agricultura  él mantiene a su familia. Paulino para poder seguir sembrando él necesita capital de trabajo de tres mil quetzales, es por eso que él está tocando las puertas de la institución ADICLA solicitando un prestamo este capital lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas. 
Pues la meta de Paulino es incrementar su siembra  para generar más ingresos y ganancias para lograr otros proyectos y lo que anhela Paulino es construir una casita más para que sus hijos tengan un lugar más amplio y cómodo para vivir. .
texts.en:
Paulino is a father of 6 children. He is 35 years old and they live in a community in Solola.

Paulino learned farming as a child. He makes a living growing vegetables such as potatoes, carrots and other products. Most of his produce he sells in the market in his community and some of it he sells to customers who come to where he works. To gain more income and profits from his crops, he involves his children during the planting and harvest season so that they can help him and he can avoid paying wages to other workers.

Paulino has no other income. He is happy with his work because with the income from farming he can support his family. To be able to continue planting crops he needs working capital of three thousand quetzals. For this reason, he has asked the ADICLA institution for a loan. The capital will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers and seeds.

Paulino's goal is to increase his crops in order to generate more revenue and profits to achieve other projects.  What Paulino longs for is to build another small house  so that his children have a bigger and more comfortable place to live in.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 60 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children now at their adult age. 

Crisanta is engaged in agri-farming, particularly in coconut production and rice retailing businesses for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing four sacks of rice for retail.
 
Crisanta has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Crisanta hopes to expand her rice retailing business.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of rice for retail

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 23 years old and lives in Sipaloc, Sibutad. She is married with three children. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field.  In need of additional working capital, Evelyn joined Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans and recently requested a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to pay for labor and two sacks of fertilizers. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and fertilizers

loans.name: Edicta Esther

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dapreydi, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Esther, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es albañil.
Doña Esther al ver que su marido no gana mucho y que en ocasiones no tiene trabajo hace un año y con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del grupo surtió en su casa   una pequeña tienda de viveras, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros víveres primarios, ella con cada crédito recibido ha ido aumentando la variedad de productos con lo cual le quedan mejores ingresos, ella también se dedica a la cría de chanchos con lo cual se gana algo extra.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva un año en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The Dapreydi Credit Group meets fortnightly in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic, and most of its inhabitants make a living from agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

Esther, who is 38 years old, lives in this place. She has a life partner and two 2 adult children who are independent. Her husband is a bricklayer. Seeing that her husband does not earn much and at times does not have work, Doña Esther used her first loan from the group a year ago to stock a small grocery store in her home. There she sells sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other basic items. With each loan received she has increased the variety of products which has lead to an improved income.

She also raises pigs and earns some extra money in this way. 

This loan will be used to continue to stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other staple items. She has been in the Credit Group for one year and she likes it because the credits have allowed her to to start her business. Her goals are to continue developing her store every day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other basic grocery items.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 48 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children, three of whom are now at their adult age and four are still school age. Wilma is now engaged in a food supplement business. At present, she is also an elected Barangay Official in the community. She is earning roughly PHP 5,000 each month from this type of work and from the honorarium. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of food supplements for resale. Wilma became a member of PMPC one year ago. In the future, she hopes to be a major stockist of a food supplement dealership business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of food supplements for resale

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is grateful that she was again granted a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help to fund their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to pay for the registration and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her income from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. That is why she is thanking God and you in advance for the continuous financial help that is being extended to her.

Benilda believes that her business will grow as she plans to buy another unit. She prays for her family's health and a prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the registration and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at a high school since 2008. Their elder two children go to secondary school and the younger two children stay at home. Her husband works at a vacuum windows factory. She is requesting a loan of 520 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Gulhan

texts.ru:
Это Гулхан. Она занимается растениеводством в районе, где имеет земельный участок. Этим видом деятельности она занята уже более 2 лет. Ей нравится это деятельность. Гулхан каждый сезон получает хороший урожай. Ведь ее труд этого стоит, она трудится старается, чтобы получить богатый урожай. Для этого надо хорошо готовит почву, и семена должены быть качественными. Гулхан берет кредит, чтобы купить семена картофеля и минеральные удобрение. Это кредит поможет ей улучшить и расширить деятельность.
Гулхан проживает на районе вместе семьей. Она замужем и имеет детей. Ее муж занимается растениеводством вместе Гулхан. В будущем Гулхан планирует увеличить расширить деятельность растениеводство. Гулхан заранее выражает Вам свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This is Gulhan. She grows farm crops in her region, where she owns a land plot. She has been in this line of work for over two years and enjoys it. Every season she harvests a large quantity of crops. This is the result of her hard work: she does all she can to produce a bountiful harvest.  For this she needs to cultivate her sol properly and buy quality seeds. Gulhan is taking out a loan in order to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers. This loan will allow her to enhance and expand her business.

Gulhan lives in the region with her family. She is married and has children. Her husband does farming together with Gulhan. In the future, Gulhan plans to keep developing her farming business. Gulhan express her gratitude to you in advance.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 51 years old and a single mother with one child. She has managed a gowns-for-rent service in their village for almost sixteen years and earns a net income of PHP 20,000 per month. Her net income on her business was spent purchasing additional materials needed to use in her business. Due to insufficient capital to use in her gowns for rent, she would like to request a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional gowns for her business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase additional gowns for rent in her business.

loans.name: April Love

texts.en: April Love is 26 years old and married. She is from Oroquieta, Philippines. She has had a snack vending business earning approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of activity for two years. This is how she helped her husband in sustaining their needs. April Love wants to provide her family with a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house. She has recently become an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 59 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children now at their adult age. 

For her source of living, Betty is earning income from her parcel of cocoland and rice land. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a surviving spouse of her late husband. She receives approximately PHP 1,700 each month, which is so helpful to meet some of her needs.  She is also receiving support from her children. She has requested a loan to be used in paying the tuition fees of her grandson who is now studying in college taking a BS in Maritime Engineering. 

Betty became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Betty hopes to engage in a buy and sell business.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees of her grandson

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en: Jelly is 55 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, one of whom is an adult and one is a teenager. Jelly and her husband have been engaged in a beef and meat vending business for 10 years already and earn approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business. At present, she is receiving a monthly allotment from her son who is a seaman. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase a brand new motorcycle for business use. Jelly has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Jelly hopes to expand their beef and meat vending business.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motorcycle

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow already and works hard to support her everyday needs.

Merlinda is a tricycle operator, and she drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Cavite, the tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even use this transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan which she will use to for pay spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle. It is important that her tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure efficient and continuous service.  She is positive that this will boost her income, as a tricycle is a common means of transportation in their area.

Merlinda dreams of being successful and having another business to help support her aging parents. She prays for good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship*  members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Blanca Nieve

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dapreydi, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 13 años, ambos estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante de mariscos.
Doña Blanca es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para  así ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos y  también vende en la casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días.  Ella también cría pollos  con lo cual se gana algo extra, lleva más de 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y alimento para los pollos. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Dapreydi Credit Group meets fortnightly in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic, and most of its inhabitants make a living from agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Blanca, who is 44 years old, lives in this place. She has a life partner and two 2 children aged 19 and 13 years, who both study at high school. Her husband is a fish vendor.

Blanca is a woman who likes to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells all kinds of clothing, and she does door-to-door sales. She goes out two or three times a week to offer her products and she also sells from home. She sells her products on credit and charges every week. 

She also raises chickens, and this gives her extra earnings. She has been doing this for more than a year.

This loan is to purchase clothing and chicken feed. She has already had 2 loans in the Credit Group and she likes it because they have always helped her with the loans. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa works hard to support her family. Rufa is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Rufa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

Rufa has been in this business for 30 years now.

Rufa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business

loans.name: Charine

texts.en:
Charine is 33 years old and has three children. Charine is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Charine is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Charine requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

Charine has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Charine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 56 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Edna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing like fish net and bamboo.

Edna has been in this business for 30 years.  In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing like fish net and bamboo

loans.name: Borkhuu

texts.en: Mr. Borkhuu, 25 years old, lives with his wife and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a private company since 2000. His mother is expert in the field of growing fruits such as sea buckthorn, blackberry and strawberry. His wife has taken her maternity leave and is currently staying at home. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to dig a well on his mother's land on which fruit seeds are planted. Last year, his mother was awarded as the best fruits harvester.

loans.use: to dig a well in order to plant fruit seeds

loans.name: Jacinta Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dapreydi, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacinta, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tiene hijos. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Jacinta con su esposo  tienen un local en el cual venden todo tipo de arreglos para fiestas, al esposo realiza arreglos los mismos que luego venden al público, allí además de estos productos venden globos, piñatas, sorpresas entre una gran variedad de productos. Tienen más de 1 año en este local pero muchos años con esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su negocio, va a comprar globos, piñatas y materiales para las manualidades que elaboran. Lleva 3 ciclos  en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Dapreydi Credit Group meets fortnightly in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic, and most of its inhabitants make a living from agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Jacinta, who is 24 years old, lives in this place. She has a life partner but does not have any children yet. Her husband is a salesman. Jacinta and her husband have a store where they sell decorations for parties. Her husband makes the decorations that they later sell to the public. They've had this store for more than a year, but have been engaged in this activity for many years.

She is going to use the loan to stock their business and purchase balloons, piñatas and supplies for the crafts they they do. This is her third term in the Credit Group and she likes it because the loans help them a lot. Her goal is to continue to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase balloons, piñatas and craft supplies.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse is 46 years old and has five children. Jesse is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Jesse is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jesse requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jesse has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Jesse would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Araceli works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock businesses. Araceli is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and has three children. Jocelyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works hard to support her family. Rose is married and has a farming sugarcane business in the Philippines.

Rose requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rose has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aurella

texts.en:
Aurella works hard to support her family. Aurella is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Aurella requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Aurella has been in this business for six years now.

Aurella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old, single and has two children.

Josephine is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been in this business for 37 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and married with six children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 32 years old and has three children.  Melody is single and has two children who are currently in school.

Melody is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Melody requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melody has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 25 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ana Mae has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ana Mae requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ana Mae has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ana Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tatang

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of our agents, Tatang. Tatang lives in Tenjo Laya, Bogor, West Java. He lives there with his wife and his three children, and joined Ruma 10 months ago. He decided to join Ruma 10 months ago, and he feels really happy that he joined Ruma because he thinks that Ruma has the best service and system. 

Tatang and his wife own a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and some household utilities, like cooking oil and liquid petrol gas.  Fortunately, all of his children are going to school. His wife is a full-time housewife and mother, so their income is only coming from their small business. Tatang needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime credits. Your loan will help him to improve his business.  Tatang is in the photo above. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for materials needed in her tailoring business. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 25,000 loan which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. Ruth has to meet the demands of her customers for new office and school uniforms. She earns a minimum of 700 PHP a day. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help their everyday sustenance.

Ruth hopes to grow her business, to buy a new sewing machine to increase her business and enable her to save for her old age. She prays for a long and healthy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Cecelia is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Ma. Cecelia has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products like body spray, lipsticks, lotion, and deodorant to sell to her customers.

Ma. Cecelia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Cecelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like body spray, lipsticks, lotion, and deodorant to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 63 years old and married with five children. Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 56 years old and married with seven children.  

Felicisima is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Felicisima requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Felicisima has been farming sugarcane for 25 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Felicisima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juna is 43 years old and both of her children are in school.

Juna has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Juna requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

Juna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Juna would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 60 years old and married with three children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, spices and coffee to sell.

Violeta has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from butcher meat, motorcycle transport and farming rice.

Violeta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, spices and coffee to sell

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 48 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cirila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cirila requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Cirila has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Cirila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Morena

texts.en:
Ma. Morena is 44 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

Ma. Morena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Morena has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Morena aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Loreta requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for twelve years.

In the future, Loreta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rijalullah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Please meet one of our agents, Rijalullah! He lives in a village named Kampung Babakan, located in Bogor, West Java. He lives there with his wife and his two children and he just joined Ruma two months ago. He feels happy because he can gain insights from Ruma staff about how to manage his money well. 

Rijalullah's wife is a full-time housewife. Both of his children are going to school, and he is very concerned about his children’s education. As a father, Rijalullah is the one who supports his family's needs. He runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits, and he also serves utility bill payments for his customers. As his business runs, he needs to get a loan from Kiva that will be used to process mobile airtime credits and electricity bill payment transactions. In the photo, Rijalullah is standing in front of his small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine is 32 years old, has 6 children, and lives in Kome B village in Kenya. Justine works as a subsistence farmer for a living. Her community of Kome B village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Justine is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Justine represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Justine and four other promoters in her community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Justine wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser program will help to prevent  water-borne diseases. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Justine’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, farming oysters in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marilou has been farming oysters for two years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mildred works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mildred is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Berlin's Group

texts.en:
Berlin is 32 years old, has 7 children, and lives in Sangure Pefa village in Ndhiwa sub Kenya. Berlin works as a peasant farmer for a living. Her community of Sangure Pefa village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Berlin is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Berlin represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Berlin, and another promoters in her community, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Berlin wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will kill germs, thus making water safe for drinking.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Berlin’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
In Kipingi village in Ndhiwa sub  County, Kenya, Rose has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Rose is a friendly member of the community with 9 children. Rose lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and iron roof.

Kipingi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Kodera water point. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Rose’s family, and the 30 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Rose has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Rose volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community to treat their water as a means of preventing water-borne diseases. There are also two other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan:  John and Everlyn.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rose’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old, has 3 children and lives in Bogesia B village in Kuria East Sub-county, Kenya. Bogesia B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a local well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Susan and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Susan works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables the community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Susan and another promoter in her community, Catherine, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Susan will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Susan wants to be a promoter because she believes that treating water with the chlorine dispenser will alleviate the number of reported cases of water-borne diseases, thus enabling the community to focus on developing activities within the area.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Susan’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Susana María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dapreydi, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Susana, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 4  años, ambos estudian en escuela e inicial. El marido es chofer.
Doña Susana es una joven muy trabajadora que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas empanadas de plátano con queso, pollo o carne, esto a gusto de sus clientes que cada fin de semana prueban estas delicias acompañadas de jugos naturales o sodas, ella de viernes a domingo instala un pequeño local en las afueras de su casa para vender, solo trabaja estos tres días porque es cuando más personas visitan el lugar, así ella logra ganar algo con su esfuerzo y honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos, colas y frutas. Lleva 2 años  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group Dapreydi meets every five days in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic and having great vegetation. The majority of its residents earn a living through agriculture and raising animals.

Susana lives in this area. She's 27 and has a common-law relationship, from which she has two children who are 4 and 6 years old. Both are in school and preschool. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Susana is a very hardworking woman. To help her husband with household expenses and the costs of her children's education, she makes and sells delicious banana empanadas with cheese, chicken or beef according to her customers' desires. 

Every weekend they try these delicacies, accompanied by natural juices or sodas. From Friday to Sunday she has a small shop inside her home to sell. She only works these three days because it's when most people visit the shop so she's able to make something honest from her work.

This loan is to buy groceries to make the food, as well as colas and fruit. She's been in the loan group for two years and likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy groceries, colas and fruit.

loans.name: Julia Vanessa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dapreydi, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
Aquí vive la señora Julia, tiene 30 años  de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de la abuela. Lleva 5 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en todo el tiempo que ha estado en el grupo.
Doña Julia es una joven que trabaja de maestra y también se dedica a la comercio ya que el trabajo de maestra no es continuo y ella necesita de sus ingresos para salir adelante y ayudar a su abuela que es de escasos recursos,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos naturales,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa y en el lugar donde trabaja, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5   años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y productos naturales. Sus sueños son tener un contrato estable y seguir en su negocio mejorando cada vez más.
texts.en:
The Dapreydi loan group meets every five days in the city of Tosagua. This are is known for being very dynamic and having great vegetation. The majority of its residents earn a living through agriculture and raising animals.

Julia lives in this area. She's 30 years old, single and lives in her grandmother's home. She's been in the loan group for five years and enjoys is because the loans have helped her very much for the entire time she's been in the group.

Julia is a young woman who works as a teacher and also earns a living through retail. She sells all types of clothing, shoes and natural products, going door to door. She sells in her free time, and also from her house and the place where she works. 

She sells her products on credit and charges for them every eight days. She's been earning a living from this activity for more than five years.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes and natural products. Her dreams are to have a stable contract and to continue her business, steadily improving.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and natural products.

loans.name: Sol Natalie

texts.en:
Sol Natalie works hard to support one child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sol Natalie requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Sol Natalie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es:
Juan Pedro es un hombre  muy sincero  y fiel a su palabra y por lo mismo ha logrado alcanzar sus metas en beneficio de su familia, él tiene 36 años de edad tiene una familia de 6 hijos comprendidos entre las edades de 3 meses a 11 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá. 

Juan Pedro es un hombre muy entregado a su trabajo, y es muy visionario, ese lo hace para que su familia pueda vivir en buenas condiciones, pues Juan para generar su economía él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, pues él se siente identificado con su trabajo, ya que de esta forma el mantiene a sus 6 hijos, Juan además de ser agricultor cuenta también con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, que le ayuda a complementar los ingresos de su hogar. 

Juan para poder  seguir cultivando, él solicita un prestamo que le servirá para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: semillas, abono químico  y orgánico,  Juan basándose en su experiencia manifiesta que para poder logra una buena cosecha es necesario tener todos los insumos al alcance para que se aplique en el tiempo indicado, y es por eso él espera conseguir su prestamo para generar ganancias con sus cosechas. 
Las aspiraciones de Juan es ver a todos sus hijos graduados para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida, y también más adelante poder hacer algunas mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Juan Pedro is a very sincere man who's loyal to his work. As a result, he's been able to achieve his goals for the benefit of his family. he's 36 years old and has a family of 6 children between 3 months and 11 years old. They lives in the community of Sololá.

Juan Pedro is very dedicated to his work and very visionary. He does this so his family can live in good conditions. To earn a living, Juan has worked in agriculture for more than 15 years. 

He identifies with his work, as it's how he supports his six children. In addition to being a farmer, Juan also has a small grocery store which helps supplement his household income.

To continue farming, Juan is seeking a loan which will allow him to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers applied at the indicated time. He wants to get his loan to earn income from his crops.

Juan's aspiration is to see all his children graduate so they have a better quality of life, and also to be able to make some improvements to his house later.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Teresita is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maria has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, chocolate drinks, etc.

Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Mónica se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 22  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su primer hijo. El marido es comerciante
Doña María junto al esposo hace  poco y con la ayuda de los créditos arrendaron un local en el centro de la ciudad en la cual se dedican a la venta de teléfonos, accesorios, recargas y repuestos, como su marido es técnico ofrece asesoramiento en todo tipo de teléfonos celulares. A pesar de que es poco el tiempo que tienen su local las ventas son muy buenas ya que ellos compran directamente de proveedores mayoristas por lo cual compran más barato y también venden a muy buen precio lo cual le agrada a sus clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar teléfonos, repuestos y  accesorios telefónicos. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener su propio local.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Santa Mónica, meets every 15 days in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited all year long, its gastronomy, and for being a place of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where María, 22, lives.  She has a common-law husband and is six months pregnant with her first child.  Her husband is a merchant.

With the help of a loan, María and her husband rented a shop in the city center not too long ago where they sell phones, accessories, recharges and spare parts.  Her husband is a technician and does consulting work regarding all types of cell phones.  Despite the fact that they have been in business for a short time, sales are very high since they purchase directly from wholesale suppliers.  This means they buy for less and also sell at a very good price which makes customers happy.

This loan will be used to buy phones, spare parts, and phone accessories.  María has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it because the loans help her get ahead.  Her dream is to have her own commercial space one day.

loans.use: To buy phones, spare parts and phone accessories.

loans.name: Carmen Cleotilde

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Mónica se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 3  hijos 25, 20 y 12 años, los dos menores estudian en universidad y colegio.
Doña Carmen es una muy buena madre que  para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante trabaja incansablemente, ella es maestra y trabaja en una escuela de la ciudad por lo cual recibe su sueldo mensual, pero como los gastos son muchos también se dedica al comercio, ella vende  ropa de todo tipo, productos de Avon, Belcorp y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella vende en sus ratos libres y en su lugar de trabajo, deja a cerdito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 20  años en esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Santa Mónica, meets every 15 days in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited all year long, its gastronomy, and for being a place of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Carmen, 45, lives.  She is a single mother and has three children, ages 25, 20 and 12.  The two youngest attend university and school.

Carmen is a very good mother who works tirelessly to earn an income and get ahead.  She is a teacher and works at a school in the city, for which she earns a monthly income.  But she she has many expenses so she also works as a merchant selling all kinds of clothing and Avon, Belcorp and Yanbal beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories.  She sells in her free time and at work, on a credit basis and collecting payment every eight days.  The sales provide her with extra income.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other items she sells.  She has been in the communal bank since it started and she likes the support the loans give.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Ginger Paquita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Mónica se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ginger, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 16 años, ambos aun viven con ellos y el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en la liga cantonal.
Doña Ginger es contadora y realiza trabajos contables para personas particulares pero para obtener más ganancias ella también se dedica al comercio, vende varios artículos de bazar, ella compra al por mayor en una distribuidora principal en la ciudad y luego distribuye a varios lugares, también en su casa tiene un pequeño deposito en el cual  vende estos productos y también agua en bidón con la ayuda de sus hijos, son más de 11 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le encanta.
Este crédito es para comprar agua y productos de bazar. Lleva 5 años  en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Santa Mónica, meets every 15 days in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequently visited all year long, its gastronomy, and for being a place of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Ginger, 47, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 23 and 16.  Both still live at home and the youngest attends school.  Her husband works for the cantonal sports league.

Ginger is an accountant and works for individuals.  But in order to earn more income she also works as a merchant selling bazaar items.  She buys from one of the main wholesale distributors in the city and then goes out to different places.  She also has a small store at home where she sells these items and water by the jug.  Her children help with the work.  She has been in business for over 11 years and loves what she does.

This loan is to buy water and bazaar items.  Ginger has been in the communal bank for five years and she likes the fact that the loans are fast.  Her dream is for her children to be come professionals and good citizens.

loans.use: To buy water and bazaar items.

loans.name: Mahbubai

texts.ru: Махбубаи молодая жительница города Душанбе. Ей всего 22 лет. Она не замужем. Махбубаи добрая, ответственная и активная девушка. Махбубаи проживает с мамой и папой. Махбубаи дома занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды на заказ. Ее мама помогает ей в работе. Махбубаи начала заняться шитьем женской одежды в 2012 году.
