Cristina es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo y sobre todo responsable, ella para apoyar a su familia, se dedica a la compra y venta de trajes típicos, para Cristina es un negocio rentable porque le genera sus ganancias. Pues con el propósito de  generar más ingresos, ella solicita capital de trabajo para comprar más mercadería tales como: güipiles, cortes, y materia prima ya que ella también confecciona  güipiles.
Cristina ya tuvo la oportunidad de obtener un primer crédito, por lo que manifiesta que le ayudo mucho porque pudo ampliar su negocio y a través de esa inversión logro ganancias.  Para Cristina esta sería su segundo, prestamo le gusta solicitar los créditos en ADICLA ya que las personas que atienden son muy amables. 
Cristina está muy segura que este nuevo prestamo le  será de mucho beneficio y alcanzara sus metas, lo que busca con las ganancias es comprar lotes de terreno e invertir en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristina is known as an affable and very honest woman in her community. She is 26 years old and lives with her family in the town of Santa Cruz La Laguna.
She is very dedicated to her work and very responsible. She supports her family by buying and selling traditional garments, a business that gives a good profit. Cristina wants to increase her sales and thus asks for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as 'güipiles' [traditional garments hand-embroidered by women in Guatemala], as well as cloth and other supplies, since she also makes güipiles herself.
This is Cristina's second loan. The first one she found very helpful, since it enabled her to increase the size of her business and thus her income. Cristina says asking for a loan from ADICLA is pleasant because the loan officers are very nice.
She knows this new loan will be very useful and will help her attain her goals. Her aim is to use the profits to buy plots of land and help her children through school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Zaenuddin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of our Ruma members, Zaenuddin. Zaenuddin lives in West Bogor, West Java. He lives there with his wife and his children. He joined Ruma a year ago. He feels happy because ever since he joined Ruma, he can improve his business, save more money for another business opportunity and he can give access to his community that needs the services.

In the beginning, Zaenuddin was only selling mobile airtime credits to his customers, but now, he is adding one more product of Ruma called ‘Mapan’. Mapan is a new product from Ruma, an e-commerce product for communities. By selling Mapan to his customers, Zaenuddin will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer places an order, Zaenuddin will simply send an SMS in a format to the SMS center and then the customer will pay him. After that, Ruma’s agent will come to his stall to collect the money, and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to customer's door.

As the business grows, Zaenuddin needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits. Having known about the importance of this, your loan will be very useful in helping Zaenuddin improve his business and accordingly, his community, that needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Zaenuddin is the one who is sitting in his small stall. He is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Bezhan

texts.en:
Bezhan is 63 years old. He lives in Kobuleti district with his family. The family runs a small agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow mandarin and nut trees. Bezhan is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold locally. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Bezhan decided to start an additional, more stable business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received loan, he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business. This will give him a chance to generate more income and improve the living conditions of his family. Bezhan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to furnish his salon and to buy a hair steamer machine.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years now.

Elvie is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise, and also to buy animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business.

In the future, Elvie dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed, and will help her improve her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals and animal feed.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 41, is a sari-sari store owner residing in Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has five children, ages 17, 10, 8, 5 and 3 years old.

Evelyn has operated her sari-sari or variety store for more than ten years now. She also sells gasoline. This is her main source of income.

Evelyn is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread, candies and snack foods, and gasoline. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

Evelyn dreams of making her business a success. She also wants to save money in order to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread, candies and snack foods, and gasoline.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Angela is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil for her bakery business.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Nuraim

texts.ru: Нураим 42 года, замужем, 2 детей. У Нураим среднее образование, она целеустремленна, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 19 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Нураим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 1 лошадь. Для содержания скота имеются все условия. Также Нураим  на земельной доле мерою 1,0 Га выращиает рис для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нураим обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нураим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Nuraim is 42, married, and has two children.  She has a secondary school education and is goal-oriented; she knows precisely what she wants and works with all her strength to get it.  As her family's main source of income, she has been a crop and livestock farmer for 19 years.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, Nuraim currently has two cows and a horse on her farm.  She has all the conditions in place for raising livestock.  Nuraim also has a 1.0-hectare plot of land for growing rice as a cash crop.  Her monthly income is around 20,000 som.  

For the future development of her farm, Nuraim has requested a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow to increase her livestock headcount.  She plans on putting her extra income due to the loan towards future additions of livestock to her farm and wants to set aside money to build a livestock barn.

loans.use: buy a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver fresh products to the market on time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good-quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a food vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is 51 years old, married, and has four grown-up children. 

Elena cooks food and sells it to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than a year now.  

Elena is asking to take a loan to buy ingredients, like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, and condiments. With this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

Elena hopes of making her food-vending a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru:
Это женщина Майсара. Она жительница района Дангара. Майсара занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Она 5 лет своей жизни отдала этому бизнесу. Майсара хорошо справляется животноводством. Она покупает крупнорогатый скот, откармливает их в течение 30-40 дней, потом перепродает их на местном скотном рынке. В этой деятельности ей нравится то, что ее доход зависит от нее самой. Майсара обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранять деятельность и продвигаться дальше. Это кредит поможет ей не потерять источник дохода. 
Майсара замужем и имеет пять детей. Три сына в возрасте 19,5 и 3 лет. Двое дочери в возрасте 17 и 16 лет. Ее муж работает строителем, старший сын помогает отцу в работе. Муж и старший сын свободное время помогают Майсаре в работе. Майсара заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This woman is Maysara, a resident of the Dangara district. She raises cattle and has given five years of her live to this business. She is good at raising livestock. She buys cattle, fattens them for 30-40 days, and then resells them at the local market. She likes doing this because she determines her own income. Maysara applied for a loan because she has small number of livestock and wants to continue her business. This loan will help her not to lose a source of income.

Maysara is married and has five children: three sons, ages 3, 5 and 19, and two daughters, ages 16 and 17. Her husband is a construction worker and her oldest son helps his father with his work. In their spare time, Maysara's husband and son help her with her work. Maysara expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle and save her business

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 30 years old and married.

Charlene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Charlene has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Charlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is 52 years old and a married woman with eight children; two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Damiana has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Damiana has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Floricel

texts.en:
Floricel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Floricel has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her business.

Floricel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   Josephine has a business making native bags in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for making her native bags. Josephine has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making native bags.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders! Meet Andrew, who is 32 years of age, a hard worker, and a very honest farmer. He hails from the Siongiroi area of Kenya, an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for dairy farming. Andrew has three children whom he adores and cherishes and a beautiful wife who always paints a smile on his face. 

He has been practicing mixed farming for the past six years and is making great strides. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg-selling and personal business. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family. 

Andrew has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow, thereby enhancing his milk-selling profits. 

Because of increased demand, Andrew is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. With the loan, Andrew is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Andrew is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. 

With his entrepreneurial spirit, strength, and tenacity, Andrew would like to continue fighting, so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. 

Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Andrew save more effectively. He plans to add value to his milk by packaging. With his accumulated profits, he also hopes to start manufacturing milk products, such as yogurt and cream one day.

loans.use: to buy another quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy, a married man of 54 years, has six children, all of whom attend school. He used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. 

Through the hard work of rearing goats and farming, Willy has been able to support his family, in addition to selling produce and teaching in a technical school to supplement his income. 

He desires to educate his children with the returns, as a loving father, despite challenges of competition that affect his returns. Willy is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his child for this term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a thirty-seven-year-old woman. She is single and without children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Amina is a farmer and is growing crops such as bananas, maize, beans and others for commercial purposes and to get income for the family. She has a dream of expanding her agriculture business into a large farming enterprise. Amina is faced with the challenge of bad weather, especially drought.

Amina requests money to buy fertilizers and manure for her banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua, a man of 24 years with one child, lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He earns his income from selling motorcycle spare parts and a retail shop. Joshua is hoping to grow his business and construct his commercial house from the returns to reduce rent expenses, despite high competition hindering his dream. He intends to use the loan to buy tires, tubes, oil, helmets and blocks to sell. He is hardworking, honest and cooperative.

loans.use: to buy tires, tubes, oil, helmets and blocks to sell.

loans.name: Len-Len

texts.en: Len-Len is single and has a business selling bags in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of native bags to offer for sale. She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Len-Len would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of native bags to offer for sale.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio, age 53, is married and they blessed with four children. He has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 23 years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. His net income on this business is usually spent on the payments of their electric bill and school allowances for their children. 

Due to inadequate capital for his business, he would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase vegetables, fish, and meat to sell. He's hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fish, and meat to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 54 years old, married, and has three children.  She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Luciana has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 46 years old with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending. Marivic aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 50 years old and married with three children.

Marcelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bath soap, sanitary pads, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell.

Marcelina has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marcelina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bath soap, sanitary pads, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Adelita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling firewood. Adelita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Saimir

texts.en:
Saimir is a 27-year-old single and ambitious guy who still lives with his elderly parents in a rural mountain village.

Saimir has been working for the past 7 years in the Albanian Riviera doing construction work and he loves it there. 

Since his family owns about 4 dynym agricultural lands, Saimir thought that it would have been good and also profitable if they had some cherry orchards and also some grapevines and this is the reason why he is applying for this loan.  

His parents engage in doing livestock; they have two goats and a dairy cow for their family’s needs. Saimir receives a pay of $200/month from his construction work and his parents receive both a pension in an amount of $250/month.

loans.use: to invest in some cherry seedlings and scion vines for planting
